content:
Bono, the lead singer of the iconic rock band U2, has revealed that he came close to death during the making of their latest album, "Songs of Experience." The 57-year-old musician opens up about the near-death experience in an interview with Rolling Stone magazine, revealing that it played a significant role in shaping the themes of the album.

"This political apocalypse was going on in Europe and in America, and it found a perfect rhyme with what was going on in my own life," Bono says. "And I have had a hail of blows over the years. You get warning signs, and then you realize that you are not a tank, as (my wife) Ali says. Edge has this thing that he says about me, that I look upon my body as an inconvenience."

While he does not want to discuss the details of his near-death experience, Bono acknowledges that it was a physical event that had a profound impact on him. "It's just a thing that ... people have these extinction events in their lives; it could be psychological or it could be physical," he says. "And, yes, it was physical for me, but I think I have spared myself all that soap opera."

Bono also reveals that his health scare was not the first time he has faced a life-threatening situation. In 2000, doctors wanted to biopsy him for throat cancer, but luckily everything turned out to be fine. He also broke his arm in a bicycle accident in 2014, which he calls a "comic tragedy."

Despite these close calls, Bono says that he has learned to keep some aspects of his life private. "Especially with this kind of celebrity obsession with the minutiae of peoples' lives ‚Äì I have got out of that," he says. "I want to speak about the issue in a way that lets people fill in the blanks of what they have been through, you know? It's one thing if you were talking about it in a place of record like Rolling Stone, but by the time it gets to your local tabloid it is just awful. It becomes the question that everyone is asking."

Ultimately, Bono says that his near-death experience has made him more aware of his own mortality and has inspired him to write about it in his music. "Strangely enough, mortality was going to be a subject anyway just because it is a subject not often covered," he says. "And you can't write 'Songs of Experience' without writing about that. And I've had a couple of these shocks to the system, let's call them, in my life. Like my bike accident or my back injury. So it was always going to be the subject. I just didn't want to be such an expert in it."
td_rationale:
Based on the provided message detailing Bono's near-death experience and its impact on his life and music, the content appears credible and coherent. The interview excerpts with Bono discussing his health scares, including the incident during the making of U2's album "Songs of Experience," seem consistent with known public information about the artist. The language used is typical of Bono's style and the themes discussed align with the narrative often associated with his music and personal reflections.

Therefore, based on the textual description provided, it is more likely that this message is real rather than fabricated. Hence, I would return a value of 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the detailed and coherent information provided in the message, it is more likely that the message is real. Bono's openness and willingness to discuss the near-death experience, as well as previous health scares, gives credibility to his claims. Additionally, his reluctance to divulge the specific details of the near-death event adds to the authenticity of the message. Overall, the veracity of the message is more likely, so the prediction is 1.

The emotional impact of Frankie Muniz and Jordan Fisher's return to the Dancing with the Stars: Juniors ballroom cannot be overstated. These two competitors, who faced off in the season 25 finale, have found a new family in the DWTS community. As they prepare to co-host the pint-sized version of the competition, they reflect on their journey and the love they've found along the way.

"The opening number of the premiere episode on Sunday, I think people are going to fall in love," Muniz told reporters on the red carpet after the season finale. "They‚Äôre going to go, 'Oh, this is for real. They can dance.'" The 12 celebrity kids, ranging in age from 9 to 14, have brought Muniz and Fisher closer together, and they're excited to see them succeed. "It is a true black hole of love, warmth, and genuinely rooting for each other," Fisher says of the DWTS family. "They‚Äôve built this community unlike anything that I‚Äôve ever seen, and they‚Äôve all remained in each other‚Äôs lives."

The difference between this season and the original DWTS is striking. Juniors was pre-taped over the summer, allowing the kids to be out of school and giving the pro dancers the opportunity to serve as mentors. Cheryl Burke, Witney Carson, Sasha Farber, Lindsay Arnold, and Artem Chigvintsev are just a few of the pros who will be guiding the young dancers. The judging panel, too, has fresh faces, with Mandy Moore, Val Chmerkovskiy, and Adam Rippon joining forces to give the kids valuable feedback.

"It is a little bit different with the adults," Fisher admits. "You can be more straightforward, you can be a little more New York and say exactly how you feel. With the kids, I was so grateful that we had the judges that we did. Adam, Mandy, and Val did an unbelievable job at getting across some points they needed to get across, but from a place of nurture and of love and of expecting to see growth on the other end."

The kids have responded well to the critiques from the judges, and Fisher is proud of the progress they've made. "I feel like it‚Äôs a little bit different with the adults," he says. "You can be more straightforward, you can be a little more New York and say exactly how you feel. With the kids, I was so grateful that we had the judges that we did. Adam, Mandy, and Val did an unbelievable job at getting across some points they needed to get across, but from a place of nurture and of love and of expecting to see growth on the other end. It was really beautifully done."

Muniz and Fisher are excited to see what the future holds for Dancing with the Stars: Juniors, and they hope that viewers will tune in to support the young dancers. "Frankie Muniz: I do hope that we can get the audience at home involved more with it going into the future, if we get to go again, but that all depends on if people tune in, so please tune in so we can do it again."

As for Fisher's Mirrorball trophy, he's keeping it safe at home. "It‚Äôs in my bathroom right now," he says. "I‚Äôm doing renovations on my house at the moment, so it is somewhere. It‚Äôs wherever the builders have put it, and I‚Äôm hoping that it‚Äôs in a safe place."

Dancing with the Stars: Juniors debuts Sunday, Oct. 7 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on ABC. Will you tune in to see what happens next?

In a recent interview with Closer Weekly, Betty White, the iconic actress and star of the hit '80s sitcom The Golden Girls, revealed that she has no plans to retire. The 96-year-old actress, who began her television career in 1939, stated that she will continue working "forever."

Steven J. Boettcher, who co-directed the new PBS documentary about White's life, Betty White: First Lady of Television, exclusively told Closer Weekly that White is far from ready to retire and still "loves working!" Boettcher attributed White's success to her kind nature, explaining that she never said a bad word about anyone during the production of the documentary.

White, who is the subject of the upcoming PBS documentary, has been acting since she was in her early 20s and has been honoured with six Emmys throughout her career. She previously told Parade magazine that she takes nothing for granted and is very humbled by her success.

During her career, White was a regular guest on the hit game show Password from 1961 until 1975 and met the love of her life, host Allen Ludden, on the show. They were married from 1963 until Ludden's death in 1981 from cancer.

White never remarried and remained a proud stepmother to Ludden's three children from his first marriage. She was the first woman to produce a national TV show, the first woman to star in a sitcom, the first producer to hire a female director, and the first woman to receive an Emmy nomination.

Boettcher's new PBS documentary about White's life and illustrious career, Betty White: First Lady of Television, is set to premiere on Tuesday, Aug. 21.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific information provided in the message, such as Betty White's ongoing career, recent interviews, specific quotes attributed to individuals involved with her documentary, and upcoming PBS special, it is highly likely that this is a real message rather than fabricated. LAS VEGAS, NV - America's late night comedians were in mourning following the deadliest mass shooting in US history, as they called for action on gun control to end the violence plaguing the country.

Jimmy Kimmel, tears streaming down his face, lamented the tragedy in his hometown, stating that "when someone with a beard attacks us we tap phones, we invoke travel bans, we build walls, we take every possible precaution to make sure it doesn't happen again." However, when an American buys a gun and kills other Americans, there is nothing that can be done, he said.

Stephen Colbert echoed President Trump's words, calling the mass shooting an "act of pure evil" and demanding that the US take action to combat "pure evil." He added that Congress could be heroes by doing anything on gun control, anything but "doing nothing."

Conan O'Brien reflected on the normalization of mass shootings, stating that when he started doing the job 24 years ago, mass shootings were extremely rare. He noted that during the past decade, things had changed, and it should not be "so easy for one demented person to kills so many people so quickly."

James Corden, an Englishman who has lived in the US for just over two and a half years, noted that the killings in Las Vegas were the second time in 21/2 years that the record for mass shooting deaths had been broken. He questioned how it was that every other developed country did a better job of preventing mass shootings, given the widespread availability of guns.

"Maybe the time for the thoughts and prayers of Congress members and the president has passed," Corden said. "We need to look to them to actually do something to prevent this from happening in the future."

Despite the somber mood, Corden also noted that even in these "strange times," they had a show to do, hoping to bring some levity to the most heavy of days.

Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real and factual report of reactions from late-night comedians following a tragic mass shooting in Las Vegas. The details include specific quotes from Jimmy Kimmel, Stephen Colbert, Conan O'Brien, and James Corden, reflecting on the event and calling for action on gun control. These statements are consistent with the public personas and typical responses of these comedians to significant events. Therefore, the veracity of the message is likely high.

The world was abuzz with excitement as Kylie Jenner revealed the name of her newborn baby girl. On Tuesday, the 20-year-old Keeping Up With the Kardashians star posted a heart-melting photo of her little girl holding Jenner's finger, captioning it simply, "Stormi."

The reality TV beauty had kept her pregnancy a secret from the public, choosing instead to focus on her health and well-being. But on Feb. 4, she broke her silence with a heartfelt message, apologizing to fans for keeping them in the dark.

"I understand you're used to me bringing you along on all my journeys," she wrote. "My pregnancy was one I chose not to do in front of the world. I knew for myself I needed to prepare for this role of a lifetime in the most positive, stress-free and healthy way I knew how."

Jenner described her pregnancy as "the most beautiful, empowering and life-changing experience I've had in my entire life," adding that she would miss it. And to share her joy with her fans, she created a 11-minute YouTube video titled "To Our Daughter."

"I've never felt love and happiness like this," Jenner wrote on Instagram. "I could burst!"

And she wasn't the only one overjoyed. Jenner's mother, Kris, shared the same baby-name photo on social media and wrote, "Meet my precious granddaughter Stormi! I love you endlessly."

And on Monday, proud grandparent Caitlyn Jenner took to Instagram to share her happiness over Stormi's arrival.

"My daughter just had a daughter. It's amazing to be by your side through this journey," the former Olympian wrote. "She's SO beautiful already. Can't wait to watch her grow."

And the world was right to be excited. Stormi was born on Feb. 1, and the world has been waiting with bated breath to see what the reality TV star and her rapper boyfriend, Travis Scott, would name their little girl.

But regardless of the name, one thing is certain: Stormi will be showered with love and happiness from her loving family and the world at large.

But it seems that even the most joyous of moments can't escape the prying eyes of the paparazzi, as Kutcher inadvertently revealed the sex of the baby back in October during an appearance on the Today show. content:
The meteoric rise of Donald Trump and his seemingly unbeatable political prowess have left many experts stumped, seeking an explanation as to how this occurred. To fully understand this phenomenon, we must not only examine Trump himself, but also his devoted supporters, whose unwavering admiration and devotion to their unpredictable and often inflammatory leader baffles many.

Psychologists and neuroscientists have provided numerous thought-provoking explanations for Trump's enduring support, but the accounts of these experts often vary greatly, sometimes overlapping and other times conflicting. However insightful these critiques may be, it is clear that further research and examination are needed to pinpoint the exact psychological and social factors driving this bizarre behavior.

In a recent review paper published in the Journal of Social and Political Psychology, UC Santa Cruz professor Thomas Pettigrew argues that five major psychological phenomena can help explain this exceptional political event.

1. Authoritarianism: This refers to the advocacy or enforcement of strict obedience to authority, often at the expense of personal freedom. Those with authoritarian personality syndrome, a prevalent condition, often display aggression toward outgroup members, submissiveness to authority, resistance to new experiences, and a rigid hierarchical view of society. Trump's speeches, with their absolutist terms like "losers" and "disasters," naturally appeal to those who prefer authoritarianism. Research has shown that Republican voters scored higher on measures of authoritarianism before Trump's rise, and a 2016 survey found that high authoritarians greatly favored Trump, leading to his election win.

2. Social dominance orientation (SDO): This refers to people who prefer a societal hierarchy where high-status groups have dominance over low-status ones. Those with SDO are typically dominant, tough-minded, and driven by self-interest. Trump appeals to those with SDO by making clear distinctions between high-status groups (White) and low-status groups (immigrants and minorities). A survey found that those who scored high on both SDO and authoritarianism were those who intended to vote for Trump.

3. Prejudice: While not all Trump supporters are prejudiced against ethnic and religious minorities, some certainly are. The Republican party has long used strategies that appeal to bigotry, such as "dog whistles" that signal prejudice to racists but not to others. Trump's shockingly direct appeals to bigoted supporters, such as calling Muslims "dangerous" and Mexican immigrants "rapists" and "murderers," likely play a role in his popularity. A new study shows that support for Trump is correlated with a standard scale of modern racism.

4. Intergroup contact: Contact with members of groups outside one's own has been shown to reduce prejudice. However, Trump's white supporters have experienced significantly less contact with minorities than other Americans. A study found that the racial and ethnic isolation of Whites at the zip-code level is one of the strongest predictors of Trump support, and this correlation persisted while controlling for dozens of other variables. Support for Trump increased with voters' physical distance from the Mexican border.

5. Relative deprivation: This refers to the experience of feeling deprived of something one believes they are entitled to. Trump supporters who feel that American jobs are being lost to Mexico and China may be experiencing relative deprivation, particularly in swing states like Ohio, Michigan, and Pennsylvania. This kind of deprivation is based on a skewed perception of entitlement, rather than an absolute lack of resources.

Roseanne Barr has been hit with a wave of backlash after she blamed her controversial racist tweet on Ambien, the insomnia medication she was taking. The actress and comedian, who was recently fired from her ABC show and talent agency, claimed that she was under the influence of the medication when she made the tweet that sparked outrage.

Barr first made the excuse in a series of tweets on Tuesday, saying that she was "ambien tweeting" at 2am and that she had done "weird stuff while on ambien - cracked eggs on the wall at 2am etc." She later added, "guys I did something unforgiveable so do not defend me."

But her excuse didn't sit well with people, who pointed out that she had previously tweeted racist things and that she had been fired from her show for making a racist tweet. Late-night hosts latched onto her excuse, joking that racism might be a side effect of Ambien in spoof ads.

The manufacturer of Ambien, Sanofi U.S., responded to the comments, saying that racism is not a known side effect of any Sanofi medication.

On Comedy Central, The Daily Show host Trevor Noah joked, "If you listen to their ads, there is a subtle warning about just [racism]."

In related news, Roseanne Barr has been fired from her ABC show and talent agency after she made a racist tweet. The tweet caused a firestorm and led to her being fired from the show and the talent agency.

Barr's excuse for her racist tweet has been met with widespread criticism, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency.

In a statement, ABC said, "Roseanne Barr's tweets about race are reprehensible and have no place on our air or anywhere else. We have terminated our agreement with her."

Trevor Noah joked on his show that if Ambien is taken on Memorial Day, racist side effects are amplified. He also pointed out that if you've ever asked when there will be a White History Month, used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." or previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about, then Ambien might be for you.

On Full Frontal, a fake ad for the drug showed images of individuals struggling to fall asleep with a voiceover narration stating, "If sleeping through the night feels like a far away dream, try Ambien, the prescription sleep aid that helps you get a good night's sleep and possibly makes you racist?"

The ad goes on to state that users should use Ambien if "you've ever asked when will there be a White History Month," used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." and "if you've previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about." The latter statement was accompanied by an old tweet by Barr.

Overall, the backlash against Barr's racist tweet and her excuse for it has been swift and severe. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets.

Audrina Patridge has announced that she is ending her marriage to Corey Bohan, her husband of less than a year. According to legal documents obtained by TMZ, the couple's divorce appears to have been triggered by a series of incidents that Audrina considers menacing and emotionally abusive.

The documents state that the violence began in mid-August when Audrina accused Corey of cheating. She was holding their daughter, Kirra Max, when Corey pushed her back. Corey then reportedly emptied out Audrina's backpack and purse and began punching himself in the head, and threatened to bash himself in the head with a metal canister if Audrina left. Corey had previously threatened suicide in July, while Audrina was out of town on a business trip.

On September 6, Corey was reportedly watching Kirra at home when Audrina returned. He began calling her names and harassing her, and Audrina says she started recording video of him. Corey then reportedly said, "Grow some balls and pull the trigger and file for divorce." At this point, Audrina says she was terrified and called the police.

Child protective services reportedly visited the house on September 15 to meet with Audrina. Her decision to file for a temporary restraining order against Corey on Monday, September 18, was granted. Corey and Audrina were married in Hawaii in November 2016.

A judge in the ongoing divorce case between Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt has expressed concerns about the children's lack of relationship with their father. The judge emphasized the importance of maintaining a healthy and strong relationship between the children and their parents, stating that "not having a relationship with their father is harmful to them." The judge has also ordered Jolie to provide her children with cellphones that allow Pitt to call them at any time, without Jolie monitoring, and to refrain from reading their text messages with their father.

The court has outlined a summer schedule for the children, except for Maddox, who is old enough to decide how much time he wants to spend with Pitt. Pitt will have custody of the children from June 8 to June 17, for four hours per day, while he stays in London, where Jolie is renting a house. He will designate one or two minor children to spend time with at a time and will also spend time with each child at least twice during this 10-day period. Jolie will not be present during or interfere with Pitt's custodial time.

Pitt will also have custody of the children from July 8 to July 14, when a doctor will be required to be present and will meet with the children before and after each two-day period. From July 21 to July 29, Pitt will resume custody of the children when he returns to California. The court noted that if the minor children remain closed off to their father, it may result in a reduction of the time they spend with Jolie and may lead to primary physical custody being ordered in Pitt's favor.

Jolie's spokesperson has expressed disappointment at the release of confidential court records, stating that it is not in the best interests of the children. The spokesperson emphasized that Jolie has been focused on the children's health and needs throughout the divorce.

The Weeknd has made a sensational donation of $100,000 to the Suubi Health Center, a maternity and children's medical facility located in Budondo, Uganda. The donation was motivated by French Montana's efforts to raise awareness for the health center through Global Citizen, a social action platform, and Mama Hope.

Montana's #Unforgettable Dance Challenge, which was launched to raise funds for the center, has been gaining traction and has inspired other musicians to join in on the cause. The Moroccan rapper has been spreading the word through his music video, which has been deemed a "call to action" to raise awareness for the needs of Suubi and the people of Uganda.

In March, Montana traveled to Uganda to shoot the "Unforgettable" music video and met with the founders of the Suubi Center. He was so inspired by the visit that he pledged the first $100,000 donation to help pay for ambulances, premature incubators, cribs, and a blood bank for the Suubi community.

This is just the beginning of The Weeknd's efforts to make a difference in the world. The singer is challenging others, including some of his musical peers, to join him in making donations to help pay for the new maternity center.

Click here for more information on Montana's #Unforgettable Dance challenge and how you can get involved.
td_rationale: Based on the textual description provided, the message appears to be more likely to be a real event rather than fictional. The details such as the specific donation amount ($100,000), the involvement of known personalities like The Weeknd and French Montana, the reference to a specific medical facility (Suubi Health Center in Budondo, Uganda), and the mention of initiatives like the #Unforgettable Dance Challenge and Global Citizen are specific and verifiable elements. These details lend credibility to the authenticity of the message. Therefore, I predict its veracity as 1.
cs_rationale:
Based on the provided message, it appears to be a detailed and specific account of The Weeknd (Abel Tesfaye) donating $100,000 to the Suubi Health Center in Uganda. The context of French Montana's involvement and the #Unforgettable Dance Challenge lends credibility to the story, as such initiatives are known to happen in the celebrity and charity realms.

The details about Montana's visit to Uganda, the purpose of the donation (ambulances, incubators, cribs, blood bank), and The Weeknd's challenge to others to contribute all contribute to the coherence and credibility of the message. Moreover, the involvement of Global Citizen and Mama Hope, well-known organizations in the humanitarian space, adds further legitimacy.

Therefore, considering these factors and the lack of contradictory information or red flags in the message, it is reasonable to assess this message as likely true.

**Prediction: 1**

There have been rumors that Angelina Jolie is considering adopting another child, but a source close to Brad Pitt has exclusively revealed his reaction to these rumors. According to the source, Brad has no desire to adopt any more children at this point in his life. He has a full plate caring for his existing children and does not feel the need to expand his family further.

When it comes to the rumors that Angelina may be looking to adopt again, Brad is neither surprised nor cares. He knows that Angelina has always discussed the possibility of adopting more children with him, but he has no interest in competing with her in an adoption war or trying to keep up with her in that way.

All Brad cares about now is ensuring that he is providing the best possible care for his own children. He wants to give them the attention and love they deserve, and does not feel the need to add to his family.

content: According to a recent report, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie have agreed to spend Christmas together with their six children, despite their previous divorce. The couple will reportedly celebrate the holiday together for the sake of their children, Maddox, Pax, Zahara, Shiloh, Vivienne, and Knox. A source told OK! Magazine that the couple will not be getting back together, but will still be able to celebrate as a family. The source also said that Brad enjoys spoiling his children and that Angie has softened to the idea of him playing Santa on Christmas morning. Additionally, Brad's production company Plan B will reportedly support Angie's movie First They Killed My Father. The source concluded that Brad and Angie still care about each other and want to be kind during the holiday season, which is a time for new beginnings.
td_rationale:
Based on the message provided, it appears to be a detailed report about Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie planning to spend Christmas together with their children despite being divorced. The information includes specifics about their children's names and mentions details about how they plan to celebrate the holiday as a family. The source is attributed to OK! Magazine, and it includes quotes about their relationship dynamics during this festive season, including Brad potentially playing Santa and his company supporting Angelina's movie.

Given the specific details, quotes from a named source (OK! Magazine), and the coherent narrative structure, it is likely that this message is intended to be a real report rather than a fabricated story. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the information given, the message is more likely to be false. Despite the source being named, OK! Magazine, the details seem too idealistic to be true. The idea of Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie spending Christmas together despite their divorce, and Brad supporting Angelina's movie through his production company, seems too good to be true. Additionally, the notion of Brad playing Santa for the children and Angelina softening towards him also appears to be an exaggerated narrative. Therefore, the veracity of this message is likely to be 0.

content: Jennifer Hudson left the Grammy Awards in awe as Ellen DeGeneres surprised her with her second trophy of the night! The stunning singer was given the Best Musical Theater album award for her performance in Broadway's The Color Purple, but was unable to attend the ceremony. That's when the talk show host stepped in and delivered the trophy personally to Jennifer during a heartfelt chat on Ellen's talk show. The actress was visibly moved and shocked by Ellen's generous gesture. "Oh my God! Thank you!" she exclaimed. Jennifer also gave a brief acceptance speech, noting that her first Grammy was given to her by the late Whitney Houston and her second by Ellen. Jennifer, along with the rest of The Color Purple's cast, won the award in the Best Musical Theater album category. Jennifer portrayed the role of nightclub performer Shug Avery in the musical last year, but was later replaced by Heather Headley.
td_rationale:
Based on the description provided, the message appears to be describing a specific event involving Jennifer Hudson receiving a Grammy Award for Best Musical Theater album, presented to her by Ellen DeGeneres during Ellen's talk show. The details include Jennifer's emotional reaction, her acceptance speech referencing Ellen and Whitney Houston, and her role in the musical "The Color Purple."

The message provides specific details such as names of individuals involved (Jennifer Hudson, Ellen DeGeneres), specific awards (Best Musical Theater album), and contextual details about Jennifer's involvement in the musical. These details lend credibility to the message.

Furthermore, the emotional response described ("visibly moved and shocked") adds a personal and believable element to the story. The sequence of events, from Jennifer being unable to attend the Grammy Awards to Ellen presenting her with the award on her talk show, follows a logical narrative.

Therefore, based on the textual description and the presence of specific and coherent details, the message is likely to be real rather than fabricated. Hence, I predict its veracity as 1.
cs_rationale: This message is likely to be real (1). The details of Jennifer Hudson winning the Best Musical Theater album award for her performance in Broadway's The Color Purple, and Ellen DeGeneres surprising her with the trophy on her talk show, can be easily verified through reliable sources such as news outlets, official award show announcements, and social media posts from the individuals involved. Additionally, the specific details about Jennifer's role in the musical and her reaction to receiving the award add credibility to the message. Overall, the message appears to be a genuine account of a heartwarming and memorable moment.

content: On January 27, 2017, the tabloid magazine Star claimed that the actor Joshua Jackson had been secretly dating January Jones since his breakup with his girlfriend Diane Kruger in July. However, a representative for Jones denied the allegations, stating that the claim was not true.
td_rationale:
Based on the provided message, we can assess its veracity by evaluating several factors:

1. **Source Reliability**: The message comes from a tabloid magazine, Star, known for sensational and sometimes unreliable reporting. Tabloids often prioritize sensationalism over accuracy to attract readership.

2. **Nature of Claims**: The claim is about a celebrity's personal life, specifically their dating status, which falls into the category of celebrity gossip. Such claims are often speculative and based on rumors rather than verified facts.

3. **Official Denial**: A representative for January Jones explicitly denied the allegations made in the tabloid magazine, stating that the claim was false. Denials from credible sources can cast doubt on the accuracy of tabloid claims.

4. **Timeline and Details**: The message provides specific details about dates and individuals involved, which could potentially add credibility. However, the involvement of a tabloid source and the denial weaken the overall reliability.

Considering these points, the veracity of the message appears dubious. Tabloid magazines are known for publishing unverified claims about celebrities, and the denial from a credible source further suggests that the claim lacks substantiation. Therefore, based on the likelihood of the message being true or false, the assessment would lean towards **0** (false), indicating that it is more likely not a real message.

Tabloid magazines such as Star are notorious for publishing sensationalized and false information in order to generate attention and boost sales. Additionally, the denial from January Jones' representative further casts doubts on the accuracy of the claim. Since the information comes from a tabloid and has been denied by a reliable source, it is more likely to be a fabricated story rather than a real message. content:
As the 75th Golden Globe Awards grace us with their presence this weekend, the anticipation is palpable. Hollywood's least serious award show is set to kick off the awards season, and while it may not hold the same weight as the Oscars, it often foreshadows the direction that the industry is heading in. Hosting the show this year is none other than Seth Meyers, who you may recognize from his NBC late-night show, "Late Night with Seth Meyers."

This will be Meyers' first time hosting the Golden Globes, but he's not exactly a stranger to talk show hosting. He'll be following in the footsteps of Jimmy Fallon, who hosted last year. NBC is marketing the show under the tagline "Hollywood, we have a lot to talk about," so expect lots of humor and not-at-all uncomfortable and awkward moments about the recent turmoil in Hollywood over sexual harassment and abuse.

Meyers spoke with The Hollywood Reporter about taking on the gig, revealing that he discussed it with his wife and women on his writing staff. He saw it as an opportunity to "say some things that you wouldn't be able to say in previous years."

On the film side of things, The Shape of Water leads with seven nominations, followed closely by The Post and Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, both with six nods. Lady Bird is also up for several big awards, although not for Best Director, which once again overlooked all female directors.

The TV awards are more widely distributed, with HBO's Big Little Lies leading with six nominations, but it's up against a slate of other prominent prestige shows, including The Handmaid's Tale, This Is Us, Master of None, Stranger Things, and The Crown.

The ceremony will begin at 5PM PT / 8PM ET on Sunday, January 7th, and will take place at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, California. The show will be broadcast live on NBC, as it has been since 1993. If you're in need of some extra glamour, you can tune in an hour earlier for the red carpet arrivals, which will be streamed exclusively on Facebook.

So how do you watch? If you have NBC, you can watch through an over-the-air antenna, cable, or satellite. If not, fear not! This year, NBC and the Hollywood Foreign Press Association have reached a deal to allow for online streaming of the awards show. Simply head to NBC's app or website, or check your cable or satellite provider for online access. And if you're not a subscriber, most of these services offer free seven-day trials, so you can give it a shot without committing to a long-term subscription.

Twitter will also be a great resource for following along with reactions and memes in real time, and The Verge will be reporting live on the night, with a running list of winners, reactions, and other news. So gather around the TV, gather round the internet, and let's celebrate Hollywood's finest.

The message appears to describe the upcoming 75th Golden Globe Awards, detailing information about the host (Seth Meyers), nominees (such as The Shape of Water, The Post, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, and TV shows like Big Little Lies), broadcasting details (NBC and online streaming options), and event logistics (time, location at The Beverly Hilton). It also mentions the tagline for the event and references interviews with Seth Meyers discussing his approach to hosting.

Given the specific details provided, such as names of nominees, the host, broadcast logistics, and the general structure of the awards ceremony, it seems more likely that this is a real message providing factual information about the upcoming event rather than a fabricated or fictionalized scenario.

Therefore, my prediction for its veracity is 1.

Her childhood years were spent at Graymont, the family home in Richmond, before she attended boarding school at the Lawrenceville School in New Jersey. It was here that she met her first husband, Topper Mortimer, and they began a love story that would take them to the pinnacle of society. Together, they moved to New York City, where Tinsley attended Columbia University and graduated with a degree in art history.

As soon as Tinsley landed in New York, her stunning blonde hair, her Southern charm, and her innate ability to build a personal brand propelled her into the spotlight. She quickly became the most photographed woman in the city, synonymous with the New York social scene. After working at Vogue, she transitioned to a career in public relations, always an entrepreneur at heart. She built a successful personal brand that was launched with a line of handbags, Samantha Thavasa by Tinsley Mortimer, a clothing collection, Riccimie by Tinsley Mortimer, which was sold exclusively in Japan, and a tabletop collection.

Tinsley then became the beauty ambassador for the iconic French fashion design house of Christian Dior and helped to create a lip gloss coined Tinsley Pink. She published her first novel, Southern Charm, and made her television debut in the hit TV show Gossip Girl in 2010. When she and Topper divorced, she decided to take a sabbatical from the fast-paced and overwhelming lifestyle that she created for herself in New York City. A respite in Palm Beach gave her time to reflect on her accomplishments, and in late 2016, Tinsley decided to move back to New York City and prove that there is more to her than meets the eye.

She launched with a range of eyelashes in three different sizes, a giftset titled a Wink & Kiss, and created her favorite shade of lip gloss, appropriately titled Vodka Cran.

Now that Tinsley is finally back and settled into her New York groove, she is ready to open herself up to finding the perfect match with whom she can continue to build her empire and share her special love for animals.

R. KELLY UNVEILS 19-MINUTE SONG ADMITTING TO SEXUAL ABUSE CLAIMS AND TROUBLES IN LIFE!

In a shocking move, R. Kelly has released a new 19-minute song, "I Admit," addressing the sexual abuse claims against him and revealing the personal troubles that have plagued him throughout his career.

The track, which was posted to Soundcloud on Monday, begins with the lyrics, "I admit I have made some mistakes/And I have some imperfect ways." Kelly then gets personal, singing that he likes "all the ladies, that's both older and young ladies," followed by the statement, "But tell me how they call it pedophile because that (expletive) is crazy."

The embattled entertainer, whose real name is Robert Sylvester Kelly, has long been accused of behavior that has ranged from questionable to criminal. He was accused of child pornography after a widely circulated videotape appeared to show him having sex with, and urinating on, a teenage girl. He was acquitted of all charges in 2008 and continued to rack up hits and sell out stadiums around the country.

On "I Admit," Kelly sings that he's "not convicted, not arrested, dragged my name in the dirt/All this work to be successful, when you abandon me 'cause of what you heard." The song also reveals that he was sexually abused as a child, with the lyrics, "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

Kelly is one of pop music's best-selling artists and his hits include "Ignition," ''I Believe I Can Fly," ''Step in the Name of Love" and "Bump N' Grind." He has also written hits for artists ranging from Celine Dion to Michael Jackson to Lady Gaga. While he's written classic love songs and even gospel music, he is defined by sexually explicit songs such as "Feelin' on Yo Booty," ''Your Body's Calling Me," ''Sex Me" and even more explicit fare.

On the new song, he says he was sexually abused as a child, singing "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

The song has sparked outrage on social media, with celebrities and activists condemning Kelly and calling for his arrest. Rapper Talib Kweli Greene said in a Twitter post, "His lack of self-awareness is atrocious. There are several lyrics I take offense to. The one I will address is 'I‚Äôm just a man.' I am also a man. I would never use that to defend this behavior."

In conjunction to the #MeToo movement, Viola Davis, Shonda Rhimes and Ava DuVernay and other celebrities participated in the Time's Up movement's #MuteRKelly social media campaign in April, calling for a boycott of his music and performances.

Kelly's concert in his hometown of Chicago was canceled around the time the Times' Up campaign took aim at the singer over allegations he sexually abused women. Weeks later, Spotify removed his music from its playlists, citing its new policy on hate content and hateful conduct.

The song was not released on Sony's RCA Records, where Kelly is signed. The label said it had no comment about the song. Kelly posted a link to the song Monday with the caption: "Today is the day you've been waiting for."

In May, a woman filed a lawsuit against Kelly, accusing the singer of sexual battery, knowingly infecting her with herpes and locking her in rooms for punishment.

Kelly's new track is a bold move, but it's unclear if it will be enough to save his career, which has been put on hold due to the sexual abuse claims. The #MeToo movement has exposed the dark side of the entertainment industry and Kelly's admission may not be enough to repair the damage to his reputation.

Kelly's fans will have to decide if they can forgive him for his past mistakes and support him moving forward. Only time will tell if Kelly's admission will be enough to save his career and repair the damage to his reputation.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, the veracity of the claim that R. Kelly unveiled a 19-minute song admitting to sexual abuse claims and troubles in his life is likely to be true. The message details specific lyrics from the song "I Admit," including admissions of personal flaws and controversial statements addressing the accusations against him. It also discusses the social media outrage and reactions from celebrities, which align with the context of the #MeToo movement and previous controversies surrounding R. Kelly. Therefore, the likelihood that this is a real message is high. Hence, the prediction is 1.

EXCLUSIVE: John Legend Makes History as Youngest EGOT Winner!

In a shocking turn of events, John Legend has made history as the youngest person ever to achieve the coveted EGOT status! The talented singer, actor, and producer completed the acronym at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday, along with Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice, all for producing the best variety special winner Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert.

At just 39 years old, Legend is not only the youngest EGOT recipient but also the first black man to land this prestigious title. He also played the role of Jesus in NBC's production of the 1970 concept album-turned-Broadway musical, and he's up for the Emmy for outstanding actor in a limited series or movie, which will be revealed at the big primetime Emmy Awards on Monday.

Before Sunday night, only 12 people had ever won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony in competitive categories! But Legend, along with Webber and Rice, joined this elite group when they won an Emmy for their production of Jesus Christ Superstar.

Legend's wife, Chrissy Teigen, couldn't help but celebrate her husband's achievement on Twitter. She posted a photo of the three "EGOT GOATS" and wrote, "Now, we're just waiting for Teigen's dad's response."

The 70th Primetime Emmy Awards will air on Sept. 17 at 5 p.m. PT on NBC. Don't miss it!

John Legend achieving EGOT status as the youngest person ever and the first black man to do so is a significant and verifiable event in entertainment history. An attorney for Weinstein, who has previously denied allegations of non-consensual sex, confirmed that he would plead not guilty to all charges filed by Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. The investigation into Weinstein, which began after the New York Times and the New Yorker reported in October that dozens of women had accused the Hollywood producer of sexual harassment and assault, follows months of determined reporting and the #MeToo movement.

The allegations against Weinstein have been the subject of several civil suits, and this is the first time he has faced criminal charges. In October 2015, Vance Jr. declined to press charges after investigating whether Weinstein groped Italian model Ambra Battilana. Asia Argento, who has accused Weinstein of sexual assault, expressed hope for justice on Friday, stating, "We, the women, finally have real hope for justice."

While the New York charges are the first against Weinstein, several other cities have also launched investigations into the producer in the wake of the allegations. Federal prosecutors have opened a criminal investigation into Weinstein's alleged sex crimes, and the Los Angeles County District Attorney's office is reviewing five investigations. London's Metropolitan Police is also investigating Weinstein, although no charges have been filed against him in London as of Friday.

Based on the provided message, which details Harvey Weinstein turning himself in to face charges related to rape and other sexual misconduct allegations, along with confirmation that he intends to plead not guilty, the veracity of this message appears high. The message also contextualizes the events within a timeline starting from initial reports in October, referencing the #MeToo movement and subsequent legal actions in various cities and jurisdictions.

Jimmy Fallon has finally broken his silence about his controversial interview with Donald Trump last September, revealing that he was left "devastated" by the backlash he faced.

"I'm a people pleaser," he admitted in a stunning New York Times interview that was published Wednesday. "If there's one bad thing on Twitter about me, it will make me upset. So, after this happened, I was devastated. I didn't mean anything by it. I was just trying to have fun."

Fallon was slammed for playing with Trump's hair during their now-notorious interview on "The Tonight Show," with many accusing him of being too soft on the divisive then-presidential candidate. Comedian Billy Eichner, for example, blasted Fallon, saying it wasn't "a good moment."

But Fallon defended the interview, insisting that he wasn't trying to "humanize" Trump. In fact, he confessed that he did it to "minimize him."

"I didn't think that would be a compliment: 'He did the thing that we all wanted to do,'" Fallon explained.

After facing a barrage of hate on Twitter, Fallon said he couldn't escape the negativity even when he tried to read the news or check his social media accounts.

"I go, I just can't read Twitter," he revealed. "Then I can't read the news. I can't read the internet."

Fallon now wishes he had addressed the issue on air when the backlash didn't subside, even after a couple of days: "I didn't talk about it, and I should have talked about it. I regret that."

Despite the uproar, Fallon is determined to stay true to himself and his humor, explaining that he doesn't want to be "bullied" into changing his show or his style.

"It's not 'The Jimmy Fallon Show,'" he declared. "It's 'The Tonight Show.'‚Äù

Read the full interview to find out what Fallon had to say about his future on the show and his thoughts on the 2020 election.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it seems more likely to be a real message (return 1). The details include specific quotes and events that can be verified, such as Jimmy Fallon's controversial interview with Donald Trump, reactions from other celebrities like Billy Eichner, and statements directly attributed to Fallon about his feelings and regrets regarding the backlash. The style and content also align with typical interviews and public statements made by celebrities in similar situations, discussing personal reactions and reflections on public scrutiny and media backlash.
cs_rationale: Based on the message provided, it is likely to be a real message. The details mentioned about Jimmy Fallon's interview with Donald Trump and the backlash he faced are consistent with events that occurred in September. Fallon's comments about feeling and being a people pleaser align with his public persona and previous statements he has made., the mention of his regret for not addressing the issue on air and his determination to stay true to himself all contribute to the credibility of this message. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 1.

First things first, let's talk about Brandon's net worth. As a talent manager, he's worked with some of the biggest names in the music industry, including Kelly Clarkson. And it seems that his hard work has paid off big time. In 2023, Brandon was awarded a whopping $10 million net worth, making him one of the wealthiest people in the business.

But how did he get so rich? Well, Brandon has been in the music industry for over a decade, starting out as a talent agent for his stepmother, Reba McEntire. He later formed his own talent management company, Starstruck Entertainment, which manages the careers of many successful musicians and actors.

But Brandon's success didn't stop there. In 2013, he married Kelly Clarkson, the stunning singer and winner of American Idol. Together, they have two children and a luxurious lifestyle. In 2018, they lived in an $8 million mansion in Encino, California, before Kelly bought a $10 million mansion in the same neighborhood.

But things didn't go as smoothly as planned in their marriage. In 2020, Kelly filed for divorce from Brandon, citing irreconcilable differences. But before things could get too far, Brandon filed for spousal and child support, asking for $436,000 per month. A judge eventually ordered Kelly to pay him $45,000 per month in child support and $115,000 per month in spousal support for two years. She also had to pay him $1.2 million to cover his legal expenses.

But things got even more complicated when Kelly claimed that Brandon had defrauded her during his 13 years as her manager. She accused him of overcharging her millions of dollars and not being licensed to operate as a talent agent. Brandon's company, Starstruck Management Group, countered by pointing out that Kelly was always properly represented by her separate talent agency, CAA.

In the end, an LA judge sided with Kelly, ruling that Brandon had indeed overcharged her. But despite this setback, Brandon still walks away with a net worth of $10 million, proving that he's one of the most successful talent managers in the business.

So there you have it, folks. The inside scoop on Brandon Blackstock's net worth, his divorce from Kelly Clarkson, and his luxurious real estate. From his days as a talent agent to his current net worth of $10 million, Brandon Blackstock has come a long way. And with his stunning wife and two beautiful children, he seems to have it all.

Anna Faris and Eva Longoria are spilling all the secrets to raising a son in their new movie, Overboard! In a shocking interview with ET, Faris revealed the hilarious andÂ∞¥Â∞¨ moments she's experienced as a mom to her 5-year-old son Jack.

When asked for advice on raising a boy, Faris joked, "I have no advice to give, except epidural immediately." But she quickly admitted that taking care of Jack in public can be a nightmare. "I don't know why my mind goes to... it is, like, the peeing thing," she confessed. "Yes, it is the toilet, it is all over the place and somebody told me to put some Cheerios in the toilet so they can aim... I don't know, it didn't really work. That is all I got."

Faris also shared the hilarious moment when she was changing Jack's diaper and a "little fountain" of urine shot up in her face. "And when you are changing the diaper, this crazy things happens -- I don't know if it is because they are relaxed -- suddenly you will get, like, a little fountain right up in your face," she laughed.

Despite the challenges, Faris is still learning as a mom. "I never sort of found myself as a natural, like, fit into motherhood but.... I don't know, I love my kid," she confessed. "We have a blast. I hope he is going to be a good person someday."

In Overboard, Faris plays Kate, a down-and-out carpet cleaner who lands a job on a yacht that is owned by the affluent Leonardo (Eugenio Derbez). Not long after, the two have an altercation that ends with Leonardo throwing Kate's carpet-cleaning machine in the ocean, but he too falls overboard and gets amnesia.

As revenge, Kate -- along with the help of her friend, Theresa (Longoria) -- decides to pose as his wife and fool him into thinking he's married to her and the father of her three children. The film hits theaters on May 4! Watch the trailer below to get a taste of the hilarious chaos.

recent reports have emerged suggesting that Queen Elizabeth II is considering stepping down from her throne. It is either Prince Charles, her eldest son, or Prince William, her second son, who will succeed her.

A tabloid claims that Queen Elizabeth is on her deathbed and has decided to make Prince William and Kate Middleton the new monarchs.

The outlet writes, "In a startling twist, the Duke and Duchess will become the next king and queen, and with Prince Charles cast aside, they're ready to modernise the monarchy."

Shunting Charles aside is an unprecedented break from tradition, but it's the right time to shake things up. Will and Kate are a welcome breath of fresh air, and they're going to do things their own way!"

"[For meetings], I amp it up a bit more by adding a bronze-y eyeshadow, a smudged eyeliner on the top so it‚Äôs not too perfect, and a coral-pink lip."

"I love a good lip balm that I can put on my cheeks every day because it gives me a dewy, fresh-faced feel," she says. "With La Mer's yummy lip balm, I‚Äôll do my lips, and then whatever is left on my finger, I‚Äôll slather it on the high cheekbone area."

"I've been using this mascara since I was 15 years old," Hough says. "I usually use the black-brown shade."

"I have good hair that listens, so sometimes when it's dry I mix Unite's 7Seconds, argan oil, and a beach-day spray in my palm and put it through my hair," she tells you. "It creates a fun little texture."

"For my lips, I love the NARS pencil chubs, so I usually use those," she tells you. "I'm sort of a 'less is more' person and I want to see my lip coming through, although I really do love red lipstick, too."

"I definitely use Proactiv‚Äîmy favorite product is their refining mask," she tells you. "Also, Proactiv MD is the new luxury, medical version which contains Adapalene, an ingredient you used to not be able to get but now can."

According to CNN, the cause of death has not yet been determined, but "at this stage, nothing suggests the intervention of a third party."

The country singer, 34, and the athlete, 37, sparked speculation about the state of their marriage after rumors began to swirl. However, Fisher put the rumors to rest on his social media account, responding to a fan who wrote that they were "praying for you and Carrie."

Fisher's response was a passage from the Bible, reading: "Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting."

While Underwood and Fisher, who have been married since 2010, have had a trying few months, their relationship remains strong. After Underwood suffered a "hard fall" outside their home in November, leaving her with a broken wrist and around 50 stitches to her face, Fisher has been by her side during her recovery.

Underwood has been open about her recovery process, sharing photos of herself working out with Fisher and their son Isaiah Michael, who turns 3 this month. She captioned the photos on Instagram, "My boys make work outs fun (and a bit less productive, but that's ok)."

Overall, Underwood and Fisher have refuted rumors of marital troubles and remain committed to their relationship.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it appears to be more likely a real report rather than fabricated. The message includes specific details about Carrie Underwood and Mike Fisher addressing rumors of marital issues and clarifying their relationship on social media. It mentions Fisher's direct response to a fan on Instagram with a passage from the Bible, which is consistent with how public figures often respond to rumors to reassure their fans and followers. Additionally, details about Underwood's injury and recovery, along with their family dynamics, provide further context and authenticity to the message. Therefore, I would assess the veracity of this message as 1.

Additionally, the message includes specific quotes and actions from both individuals, which adds to its authenticity. Therefore, the veracity prediction for this message is 1.

The holiday season has arrived, and there is no one more surprised at how quickly 2018 has flown by than Chrissy Teigen. The model and Lip Sync Battle star, 33, revealed during a Nov. 28 Q&A session that she feels like the holidays really snuck up on her.

Teigen and her husband, John Legend, were filming their holiday special A Legendary Christmas over Halloween time, while their 2¬Ω-year-old daughter, Luna Simone, was left confused because she was expecting a different kind of seasonal celebration. Luna even went trick-or-treating at Universal Studios to celebrity trailers, and still asks for Halloween.

The couple is now "establishing traditions" with Luna as she starts to understand the meaning of the holiday. Teigen admits that she didn't even know if she wanted Luna to believe in Santa, and didn't know which way she wanted to go with it. "John and I are just like, 'I don't know, we'll figure it out when she asks, I guess,'" she said.

Despite the stress of the holiday season, Teigen is excited to shop for her family and see them get excited about something, even if it's just milk for her 6-month-old son, Miles Theodore. Teigen joked that everything her family does over the holiday season is "about photos," and admitted that she wishes she had more time to take it all in.

For now, Teigen is content watching others open their gifts instead of receiving ones of her own. She just wishes she had more time to enjoy the holiday season.
td_rationale:
Based on the provided message, it appears to be describing a personal anecdote involving Chrissy Teigen, her family, and their approach to the holiday season. The details include specific events such as filming a holiday special, their daughter's confusion over Halloween celebrations, and Teigen's thoughts on establishing holiday traditions with her children. These specifics suggest a coherent narrative typical of a real-life situation rather than a fabricated story. The inclusion of personal reflections and humorous anecdotes also adds to the authenticity. Therefore, the message is more likely to be real.

**Prediction: 1**

Police announced the arrests of two individuals in the murders of four women that occurred at the Fairmont Terrace Apartments last month. The brothers, James Stanford Poore, 32, and Cedric Dwayne Poore, 39, were each booked on four complaints of first degree murder.

On January 7, 2013, four women, Rebeika Powell and Kayetie Powell-Melchor, both 23, Misty Nunley, 33, and Julie Jackson, 55, were found shot in the head with their hands tied behind their backs inside a Tulsa apartment. A 3-year-old boy was also found unharmed in the apartment.

Witnesses reported that the brothers left the apartment in the same building and returned later with a bag full of drugs, cash, and jewelry. According to the report, James Poore told the witnesses that he shot one of the victims because she could identify him and that Cedric shot the other three.

Cedric Poore has been in jail on a traffic violation since January 14 and James Poore was arrested on Wednesday. Both have been previously convicted and incarcerated for robbery with a firearm.

Chief Chuck Jordan said the murders were not gang-related and that more arrests may still be made.

Mayor Dewey Bartlett released a statement expressing confidence in the police department's efforts and noting that the issue is bigger than crime and about poverty. The city is moving forward on a mission to hold out-of-state apartment owners accountable for safe and secure places to live.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed information provided in the message, including specific names, dates, locations, and official statements from police and the mayor, it is highly likely that the message is reporting a real event. The inclusion of specific details such as the names of the victims, the circumstances of the crime, the arrest of suspects with prior criminal records, and the involvement of law enforcement officials lends credibility to the authenticity of the report. Therefore, I would return 1, indicating that the message is more likely to be real.

content:
On Sunday night, the Screen Actors Guild (SAG) Awards were held, honoring the outstanding performances in film and television. The ceremony, which was hosted by Kristen Bell, was broadcast live on TNT and TBS.

The winners of the evening included "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," "This Is Us," "Veep," and "Big Little Lies," which took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture. In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role category, Frances McDormand won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Saoirse Ronan took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role. In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series category, "This Is Us" was the winner.

In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series category, Elisabeth Moss took home the award for "The Handmaid's Tale," while Sterling K. Brown won for "This Is Us." In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series category, Jason Bateman won for "Ozark," while Peter Dinklage took home the award for "Game of Thrones." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Television Movie or Miniseries category, Nicole Kidman won for "Big Little Lies," while Alexander Skarsgard took home the award for "Big Little Lies."

In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role category, Sam Rockwell won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Mary J. Blige took home the award for "Mudbound." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role category, Allison Janney won for "I, Tonya," while Reese Witherspoon took home the award for "Big Little Lies." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series category, "Veep" won, while "GLOW" took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series. In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Comedy Series category, William H. Macy won for "Shameless," while Julia Louis-Dreyfus took home the award for "Veep." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Motion Picture category, "Wonder Woman" won.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it appears to be describing an event that could realistically occur, specifically the Screen Actors Guild (SAG) Awards ceremony. The details include specific winners across various categories in film and television, hosted by Kristen Bell and broadcast live on TNT and TBS, which are typical attributes of such an awards show. The mention of winners such as Frances McDormand, Saoirse Ronan, Elisabeth Moss, and others aligns with credible award categories and recipients known to participate in SAG Awards ceremonies. Therefore, the message is likely to be a real report of the event. Hence, I predict its veracity as 1.

As a result, Blake has decided to move on from the relationship, and will be going on tour without Gwen for the latter part of the month. The source adds that after their "nastiest argument ever," Blake took off without saying goodbye, leaving Gwen feeling "upended."

4. **Inconsistent Details**: The mention of Gwen being jealous of Blake's closeness with Chloe Kohanski and reaching out to Miranda Lambert for comfort seems speculative and lacks substantiation.

Considering these points, the message appears more like a sensationalized tabloid report than a reliable news source. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 0.

"A new day is on the horizon!" she declared, sending the audience into a frenzy of excitement and speculation. "Nobody ever has to say 'me too' again!"

The beloved veteran actor, Tom Hanks, spoke to The New York Times about the recently uncovered allegations of harassment and assault against Harvey Weinstein. Despite never working with Weinstein, Hanks expressed his disgust and shock at the allegations.

When asked why Hollywood ‚Äúsheltered‚Äù Weinstein despite rumors of his inappropriate behavior, Hanks rejected the excuse that his behavior could be considered old-fashioned. He asked, ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs a really good question and isn‚Äôt it part and parcel to all of society somehow, that people in power get away with this?‚Äù

Hanks emphasized that power in Hollywood can be rather manipulative. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs like, well, what do you want from this position of power? I know all kinds of people that just love hitting on, or making the lives of underlings some degree of miserable, because they can,‚Äù the actor said.

‚ÄúThey think their achievements entitle them,‚Äù Hanks said, proceeding to reference a quote about power. ‚ÄúSomebody great said this, either Winston Churchill, Immanuel Kant or Oprah: ‚ÄòWhen you become rich and powerful, you become more of what you already are,'‚Äù Hanks said.

Hanks agrees with the quote, saying he supports the negative backlash against the movie mogul. ‚ÄúI would say, there‚Äôs an example of how that‚Äôs true. Just because you‚Äôre rich and famous and powerful doesn‚Äôt mean you aren‚Äôt in some ways a big fat ass. Excuse me, take away ‚Äòfat,'‚Äù Hanks said. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm not, you know, I‚Äôm not the first person to say Harvey‚Äôs a bit of an ass. Poor Harvey ‚Äî I‚Äôm not going to say poor Harvey, Jesus. Isn‚Äôt it kind of amazing that it took this long? I‚Äôm reading it and I‚Äôm thinking ‚ÄòYou can‚Äôt do that to Ashley Judd! Hey, I like her. Don‚Äôt do that. That ain‚Äôt fair. Not her, come on. Come on!‚Äù

Hanks also commented on the sexism that continues to exist within Hollywood, referring to the show Mad Men, to which he says ‚Äúhad absolutely no nostalgia or affection for its period.‚Äù He explained, ‚ÄúThose people were screwed up and cruel and mean. And, ‚ÄòHey, wait, that‚Äôs going on today? Shouldn‚Äôt we be on this?‚Äô Is it surprising? No. Is it tragic? Yes. And can you believe it‚Äôs happening? I can‚Äôt quite believe that.‚Äù

The actor joins other Hollywood stars, such as Meryl Streep, George Clooney, Patricia Arquette, Leonardo DiCaprio, Julianne Moore, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Lawrence, in speaking out against Weinstein. The backlash against Weinstein includes him being suspended by BAFTA, fired from The Weinstein Co., and having his $5 million endowment rejected, intended for USC‚Äôs School of Cinematic Arts ability to grant scholarships to female directors. A criminal investigation has also been opened by the New York Police Department.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it appears to be a realistic account of Tom Hanks speaking out against Harvey Weinstein and discussing broader issues of power dynamics and misconduct in Hollywood. The details include specific quotes attributed to Hanks and mention various reactions and actions taken against Weinstein by Hollywood and legal authorities. Given the level of detail and coherence in the narrative, it is more likely to be a real message. Therefore, I would return 1.

The final episode of "Real Housewives of Atlanta" reunion aired on Sunday night, and it was a dramatic one. Kandi Burruss confronted Phaedra Parks about spreading a vicious rape rumor that had been plaguing the show all season.

Burruss has been fighting allegations that she and her husband, Todd, wanted to drug their co-star, Porsha Williams, and take advantage of her. Porsha revealed that Parks, who is an attorney, had told her about the rumor.

"To say I would drug somebody, there's multiple levels to that," Burruss said to Parks during the reunion. "She, as a person who knows me, knows I don't do drugs or deal with anything with drugs, but then on top of that, as an attorney why would you repeat to say somebody would drug somebody?"

"People was under my comments with the hashtag #KandiAKABillCosby," she continued. "Y'all know how much I care about my business and my brand and you're gonna sit up there and say some shit like that? It's one thing to say she messed with this person, we throw shade, whatever, but drugs?"

"You should understand that drugging somebody while they're drinking is rape," she added, starting to cry. "Y'all accused me of being a f--king rapist, that is crazy. You as an attorney, why would you do that?!"

She then walked off the set, visibly upset. Parks and Williams had a heated backstage discussion, during which Parks apologized for repeating the rumor.

When the women sat back down together, Porsha apologized to Burruss. "I'm here to be direct and I'm here to say that I am very, very upset for being used as a pawn," said Williams. "I feel horrible. From me, I am apologizing to you."

Cohen addressed Parks, saying she got caught in a "megawatt lie." "What more can I do? I apologized already and the person I'm most concerned about is Porsha," Parks said. "I'm sorry that it hurt Kandi as well."

Burruss previously told TooFab things between her and the two women were "unrepairable." The reunion episode ended with emotional apologies and attempts to make amends, but it was clear that the damage had already been done.

I am devastated to hear that Sonja Durham, the beloved friend and long-time managing director of Lady Gaga's Haus of Gaga, has lost her battle with stage four breast, brain, and lung cancer. Gaga, who has been mourning the loss of her dear friend, wrote a heartbreaking tribute on Sunday, sharing intimate photos of their friendship and expressing her immense love and admiration for Sonja.

Gaga wrote, "I don't know how to put a price on a friendship. I'm not even sure how you can assess the size of its meaning, only really your heart truly knows and it's too special for words." She went on to reflect on the impact that Sonja had on her life, both as a source of inspiration and as someone who helped her stay grounded and focused on her music.

Gaga vowed to be a voice for cancer patients and to honor Sonja's memory by being a "little stronger" every day. She wrote, "I vow to be a warrior for her and be a voice for cancer patients so the world can continue to improve the dialogue and the fight. I loved her. I still love her. And I love so much her husband Andre, stepson Sante, and friends. I made them some food yesterday. I will keep cooking. Cooking my soul until it understands this."

Sonja's passing has left Gaga and many of her fans heartbroken, and the hashtag #RIPSonja trended on Twitter as fans sent their support and paid tribute to her friendship with Gaga. Gaga's acoustic version of "Edge of Glory" at Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival was dedicated to Sonja, and her fans hope that her memory will continue to inspire and uplift those who knew her. Rest in peace, Sonja Durham.

Alan Dawson, a combat sports correspondent for Insider, was abruptly whisked away to Las Vegas after being shortlisted for Sports Journalist of the Year in 2020. He has twice been recognized by the Boxing Writer's Association of America, serves as a Hall of Fame voter, and is a proud member of the MMA Journalists Association.

Since joining Insider in 2017 as a reporter, Alan has been promoted to senior reporter and then to a correspondent in 2020. He has dedicated his career to establishing Insider Inc. as one of the top independent publications in the fight sports industry, with millions of readers worldwide every month.

Alan's relentless pursuit of truth and justice has led him to investigate the nexus between organized crime and boxing, exposing possible bribery in sports. He has witnessed some of the most unforgettable moments in combat sports history, including Fury-Wilder 2, Khabib Nurmagomedov's retirement, and Davis-Garcia.

Alan's international reporting assignments have taken him to Europe, the Middle East, and across the United States. He was one of only a few credentialed journalists to cover the UFC during the pandemic era of sports, when the company held MMA events in a bubble environment on Yas Island, Abu Dhabi.

Alan's insightful and empathetic reporting has been featured on Morning Kombat on Showtime, BBC and GB News in the UK, and The Sun in Ireland. His work has been referenced by CNN, The Telegraph, Forbes, USA Today, IB Times, Boxing Scene, World Boxing News, Sherdog, Bloody Elbow, The Sun, The Mirror, and Metro, as well as national media in Finland, Ukraine, Russia, Indonesia, Singapore, and Vietnam.

content:
"Grey's Anatomy: The Medical Drama That Never Dies"

ABC has announced the official return of Grey's Anatomy for the 2018-19 broadcast season, making it the longest-running primetime drama in history and tying it with ER as the longest-running medical drama. With over 435 episodes, Grey's Anatomy has surpassed even The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, which ran for 15 seasons and 435 episodes. Only seven dramas in the history of television have had more seasons than Grey's, including Gunsmoke, Law & Order, NCIS, CSI, and ER.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made official at the wrap party for the Shonda Rhimes drama, where ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey praised the show's loyal fans and the new generations of viewers who continue to discover the joy and drama of Grey Sloan Memorial.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made possible thanks to a new two-year deal signed by star Ellen Pompeo, who remains the highest-earning actress on a drama series. The deal includes a seven-figure signing bonus, two full backend equity points on the show, and producing fees on both the flagship series and spinoff Station 19.

Grey's Anatomy has become increasingly important for ABC since creator Shonda Rhimes left her longtime home at ABC Studios for a nine-figure deal with Netflix. Rhimes has since handed off day-to-day control of the show to Krista Vernoff, who has helped creatively recharge the series and Pompeo.

The current 14th season ranks as ABC's No. 1 drama among the advertiser-coveted adults 18-49 demographic and No. 2 at the network among total viewers. "The Hills" Cast Unveils Secrets and Scandals!

The cast of "The Hills" has finally opened up about their biggest secrets, including the infamous sex tape that rocked the reality TV world. According to producers, the challenge was getting access to the real story behind the drama.

Lauren Conrad was the one who refused to mention Heidi Montag's name, and producers had to work with her to access what they knew was the real story. Meanwhile, Heidi was still trying to make up with Lauren and wanted to be a part of the show.

But the biggest scandal of all was the sex tape rumors that Lauren didn't want to talk about. Despite this being a huge betrayal, producers knew they had to work with Lauren to get to the bottom of it.

The producers were lucky enough to be at the nightclub where Heidi and Spencer Pratt might show up. They knew Lauren was there, and they were hoping to catch up with them.

The nightclub scene was explosive, and the producers had to rush to get their cameras there. They even had to avoid filming, but the fight between Lauren and Heidi happened so quickly that they had no choice but to film it.

Justin Bobby Brescia, the anti-Spencer Pratt, was a surprise each week, as he was always putting on a show for the cameras. But off-camera, he was a genuinely nice person to everyone on the crew.

In Audrina and Justin's case, he was the bad guy who was really charming, and she was always trying to break up with him. Every time she would want to do it, they would have to have a conversation on camera so that audiences could see the process.

Lauren Conrad's mascara tears during her fight with Audrina in season 4 have become the GIF that keeps on GIF-fing from "The Hills." But the producers actually received letters asking why she didn't wear waterproof mascara.

The mascara thing just happened, and it became a thing. Most of the time, when they were shooting, they would be sitting on their balcony, and the black eyeliner roll was their only device to tell stories.

We got so many letters that were like, "Why didn't she wear waterproof mascara?", and I never could answer that. I didn't know.

In conclusion, the cast of "The Hills" has finally revealed their biggest secrets and Scandals, including the infamous sex tape and Lauren's mascara tears. Will these revelations change the way we see the show? Stay tuned to find out!
