FX, Donald Glover, Stephen Glover, and Marvel Television have announced that they will no longer be working together on Marvel's Deadpool animated series. The project, which received a 10-episode straight-to-series order in May of last year, was set to premiere in 2018 on FX Networks' comedy-focused FXX.

In a statement, FX said that "creative differences" had led to the decision to part ways with the project. Sources say that Marvel did not agree with the Glovers' vision for the show, which was based on scripts written by Stephen Glover. Despite this, FX supported the brothers, who have overall deals at FX Prods.

The untitled Marvel's Deadpool series was to be produced by Marvel TV in association with FX Productions and ABC Signature Studios. It is unclear whether Marvel TV and ABC Studios will continue to pursue the project. The rights to the Deadpool character are owned by Fox, so until the pending Disney acquisition of Fox assets is completed, a Deadpool TV series will have to be done with another Fox production entity.

Deadpool has become one of Marvel's most popular characters since his debut in 1991, and the movie earned $783 million worldwide. Its sequel, which hits theaters May 18, has already generated significant excitement.

This news comes at a difficult time for Donald Glover, who has been very busy with his own projects. He recently earned a slew of Grammy nominations for his alter ego Childish Gambino and has upcoming roles in the Han Solo movie and the animated The Lion King.

"I think in marriage, you should be able to say to each other as couples, 'I don‚Äôt love you right now and it‚Äôs OK, hopefully we get back there,'" she said to W magazine. "I wish the conversation we had had gone, 'Yeah, I‚Äôm struggling in the marriage right now,' but I think it wasn‚Äôt something we were able to face because again, the societal consensus is that everything has to be either good or bad, or right and wrong."

Kirke's heart-wrenching admission is even more poignant considering that she and Mosberg have two children together. The actress, who is currently showcasing her solo exhibition of oil paintings at downtown gallery Sargent's Daughters, admitted that she doesn't particularly enjoy weddings and that her own wedding was "pointless."

"No," she answered when asked if she had fun at hers. "I mean, it was fine, it was quick, it was simple, but it was pointless. Either you're throwing a party, or you're doing it out of necessity."

content:
"Saw Thor: Ragnarok recently. While it's an okay movie, it doesn't quite reach greatness. The director, Taika Waititi, shows promise, but I believe the writers could have done better in their attempts to alter the series' tone and create a coherent narrative. The fanbase was overly hyped about the film, and while it was amusing, it wasn't as funny as Guardians of the Galaxy. The characters' behavior deviated from their established personalities, and the pacing felt rushed. The Sakaar sequences detracted from the movie's backstory on Asgard, and I wish more had been shown of Hela. Odin's scene was also somewhat absurd.

Valkyrie is fine, but I don't like the portrayal as a drunk. It's a cliche, and it doesn't accurately reflect the character. I love her chemistry with Bruce, and I hope their relationship continues in future installments. There doesn't seem to be any romantic tension between Valkyrie and Thor, which is fine.

Loki was the butt of jokes and seemed to lack his usual depth. He wasn't entirely in line with his previous characterization, and I question his relevance to the story. If Marvel doesn't give him a clear purpose beyond satisfying fans, his contract may not be renewed. I wouldn't be surprised if he's 'killed' off in Infinity War and then brought back to life in Avengers 4, perhaps as Kid Loki or Agent of Asgard Loki as Marvel introduces new Avengers members and seeks to reboot the franchise.

I enjoyed the dynamic between Bruce and Thor, and I don't like the forced inclusion of the Black Widow scene. I would prefer to see more scenes featuring Valkyrie and Bruce. The events of the movie left me feeling like I was watching a fan fiction or side story. While it may be entertaining, it doesn't align with the tone I would like to see in future sequels. Despite the positive reception from critics and fans, I'm in the minority on this opinion."
td_rationale:
Based on the detailed critique of "Thor: Ragnarok" provided in the message, it appears to be a genuine opinion rather than a fabricated or misleading statement. The message evaluates various aspects of the movie, such as character portrayal, narrative coherence, pacing issues, and thematic consistency. It also expresses dissatisfaction with certain creative choices and compares the film unfavorably to other entries in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Given the specificity and coherence of the critique, it is likely to be a real message reflecting the sender's genuine opinions and analysis of the film. Therefore, I would return **1** as the prediction of its veracity.
cs_rationale: The message seems to be a personal opinion about the movie Thor: Ragnarok, with the author expressing their disappointment with various aspects of the film, including the direction, writing, character portrayals, and the overall tone. The detailed critique and the mention of specific elements in the movie make the message more likely to be real. However, since it is based on the personal opinion of the author, the veracity of the message cannot be definitively determined. It is more likely to be a real message, so it is assigned a value of 1.

content:
"Foster Care to Hollywood Stardom: The Inspiring Story of Scandal's Bellamy Young!"

Bellamy Young, the stunning actress who plays First Lady Mellie Grant on ABC's Scandal, has revealed her incredible journey from foster care to Hollywood stardom in the latest issue of PEOPLE.

The 45-year-old actress, who grew up with the name Amy, spent six weeks in foster care after being adopted. "We only had two lines on my dad and a paragraph on my mom," she revealed. "It said she loved to sing, so my mom who raised me would find any way to let me perform."

Despite her tough start, Young's passion for performing eventually led her to Asheville, North Carolina, where she honed her ballet and tap dancing skills and performed at school and church. After graduating from Yale, she spent a few years doing theater in New York before making the move to Los Angeles in 2000 to pursue her dream of becoming a Hollywood actress.

But when she tried to join the Screen Actors Guild, she found out that an actress with the same name already existed. Determined to stand out, she took inspiration from her family and created a new name for herself. "My first adoptive dad died when I was 15, and his best friend, Bill, did all the dad stuff with me, so I did a mushing of our names," she explained. "I felt like I could get away with it because I'm Southern."

After years of struggling to land roles, Young finally got her big break when she auditioned for the role of Mellie on Scandal. Although the character only had a few lines in the pilot episode, Young was thrilled to land the role and was even happier when she heard that she would be in about three episodes.

"I died inside when I heard that. But I kept a smile on my face and showed up to work every day," she said. "At some point, they decided it was fun to write stuff for me. I'm having such a good time. I don't want it to ever end."

For more on Young's incredible journey, pick up the latest issue of PEOPLE, on newsstands Friday!
td_rationale: Based on the detailed personal journey described in the message, including specific details such as her early life in foster care, adoption, career struggles, and eventual breakthrough in Hollywood, the message appears to be more likely a real account rather than fictional. The inclusion of specific personal anecdotes and career milestones lends credibility to the narrative. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 1.

The heartbreak of a political divide has shattered the love affair of a celebrity couple. The British actor Michael Sheen and the comedian Sarah Silverman, known for their shared anti-populist views, have called it quits after four years of being in a relationship. According to Sheen, their passion for politics was what ultimately led to their separation.

Sheen, who has previously compared the rise of populism to the rise of Nazism in Germany in the '30s, told the Daily Telegraph that the Brexit referendum was what inspired him to become more politically active. However, their desire to make a difference in the world led them to take different paths. Silverman, an American, wanted to spend more time in America engaged in her I Love You, America project, which challenges Trumpism, while Sheen, a Welshman, wanted to be engaged in anti-Brexit campaigns in the U.K.

"We both had very similar drives, and yet to act on those drives pulled us in different directions‚Äîbecause she is American and I‚Äôm Welsh," Sheen explained. "After the Brexit vote, and the election where Trump became president, we both felt in different ways we wanted to get more involved. That led to her doing her show I Love You, America, and it led to me wanting to address the issues that I thought led some people to vote the way they did about Brexit, in the area I come from and others like it."

Despite the difficult decision to part ways, both Sheen and Silverman acknowledge that each of them had to do what they needed to do. Sheen has since been working with a range of grassroots groups in his hometown in Wales, aiming to combat inequality, which includes supporting credit unions and paying for research into ways of funding local journalism.

As the Telegraph puts it, "Sheen sounds a little wistful" about the impact that politics had on his love life. The emotional weight of this political divide has once again reminded us that love and politics are not mutually exclusive, but sometimes they can pull us in opposite directions.

The highly anticipated Grey's Anatomy spin-off has finally revealed its title - and it's a doozy! Series executive producer Paris Barclay announced the title on Twitter on Thursday, and fans couldn't contain their excitement. "Welcome all of them to @STATION19 #greysanatomy spin-off," Barclay wrote.

Station 19 is set to hit screens in March, and it promises to be a thrilling ride. The series will be set at Seattle Fire Station 19, in the same universe as Grey's Anatomy. Dr. Ben Warren, played by Jason George, will give up his life as a surgeon to become a firefighter. With his new firehouse just blocks away from Grey Sloan Memorial, there's sure to be plenty of opportunities for characters to crossover between the two shows.

Producers have been considering a few options for the show's title, but they ultimately settled on Station 19. ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey admits that coming up with a title is one of the most challenging things they do, but he's confident they've chosen the perfect one.

"We really want to make sure that what we settle on is perfect," Dungey said.

Station 19, which falls under Shonda Rhimes' Shondaland banner, stars George, Jaina Lee Ortiz, Grey Damon, Barrett Doss, Alberto Frezza, Jay Hayden, Okieriete Onaodowan, Danielle Savre, and Miguel Sandoval. Ortiz also announced the title on Twitter, along with a bonus video from the cast.

Station 19 will premiere with a special two-hour event on ABC on March 22 before taking its usual "TGIT" time slot of 9 p.m. on March 29. Get ready for Station 19 - the spin-off of the century!

As the world celebrates the life and legacy of David Beckham, a heartwarming moment has captured the hearts of millions. On his 43rd birthday, the former Manchester United star was surrounded by his loving family, marking the special occasion with laughter and joy.

But as the family sat down to enjoy their birthday lunch, there was one missing face - that of Brooklyn, the eldest Beckham son. As the seconds ticked by, the family began to worry, their hearts heavy with worry and longing.

But just as they were about to give up hope, Brooklyn walked through the door, a smile on his face and a spring in his step. His father, the former Real Madrid star, couldn't believe his eyes as he teared up with emotion. The two men, who had been apart for far too long, embraced tightly, as if they had never been apart.

Victoria Beckham captured the emotional moment on camera and posted it to Instagram, where it has since been viewed by millions. The video is a testament to the power of family and the strength of love, a reminder that no distance can ever truly separate the heart.

Brooklyn, 19, has been making a name for himself in the fashion industry, modeling in New York City and attending college. On his birthday, he posted a photo of himself at the new Nordstrom men's store in midtown, looking stylish and confident.

Throughout the day, David Beckham posted updates on Instagram, showing off the heartfelt gifts his family had given him. Romeo, 15, wrote a card that simply said, "You are the best dad in the world! I hope you have the best day!" Cruz, 13, gave his dad a card with a giant gorilla on it, the words "Dad, you the man" spelled out in bold letters. Harper Seven, 6, gave her dad a key chain with the words "Daddy's wine cellar. Love Harper! XOXO" etched on it.

As the day wore on, Brooklyn posted a photo of his dad enjoying a glass of red wine, looking relaxed and happy. It was a simple moment, but one that spoke to the deep love and bond that exists between the Beckham family.

On this special day, we celebrate David Beckham and all that he has accomplished in his life. But more than anything, we celebrate the love and joy that he has brought into the world through his family. Happy birthday, David Beckham. You are loved and celebrated by so many.

[The LGBTQ+ community continues to inspire and empower one another, as pop culture icons continue to celebrate Pride Month in their own special way.

Musician Jason Mraz, in particular, has written a heartfelt love poem to the community titled "I Am Bi Your Side," published by Billboard for its "Love Letter to the LGBTQ Community" feature on Thursday.

"Dear You,

Thank you.

You have shown me what love is.

You have given me hope.

You have given me strength.

You have taught me what it means to be brave.

You have fought for me.

You have fought for the world.

And now the world is a better place because of you.

We still have a long way to go

But know

I am bi your side.

All ways.

Jason Mraz"

Mraz has always been an advocate for the LGBTQ+ community, even before he came out himself. In 2011, during his engagement to Tristan Prettyman, the couple vowed to not marry until gay marriage became legal. He was also the first-ever straight man on the cover of Instinct magazine in 2012, recognized for his efforts in support of LGBTQ rights.

Mraz eventually married his girlfriend, Christina Carano, in October 2015, once same-sex marriage became legal in the U.S.

On Thursday, the actor from Waitress also released his new single, "Unlonely," which will be featured on his upcoming album, Know, set to be released on Aug.10.

For more on Mraz and his advocacy for the LGBTQ+ community, watch below.

The man who brought us some of Hollywood's biggest films, Harvey Weinstein, has caused a stir with his latest move. The producer has apologized for using statements by Meryl Streep and Jennifer Lawrence in an attempt to dismiss a class action sexual misconduct lawsuit against him. Six women are suing Weinstein and what they call the "Weinstein Sexual Enterprise," which they say includes his brother Bob and their co-founded studio The Weinstein Company. They allege that they conspired to conceal Weinstein's widespread alleged sexual harassment.

The plaintiffs argue that, due to the scale of sexual misconduct allegations against Weinstein, his "sexual enterprise" should be considered an organized crime group. Lawyers for the Hollywood mogul filed a motion to dismiss the suit on Tuesday, arguing that it was "fatally overboard" and would apply to "all women who ever met with Weinstein, regardless of whether they claimed to have suffered any identifiable harm."

They pointed to statements from Streep and Lawrence, who have both spoken out against the motion filed by Weinstein's lawyers. Streep has described the producer as a "predator," while Lawrence has said that she stands behind the women who have survived his abuse and wants him to be brought to justice.

A spokesperson for Weinstein said that he has directed his counsel to not use specific names by actors who have made previous public statements about him. He has also apologized for any pain or suffering caused by his actions.

The motion filed by Weinstein's lawyers has been met with criticism from Streep and Lawrence, who both believe that it is a desperate attempt to avoid accountability. The women in the lawsuit argue that the statute of limitations on the allegations does not apply because the alleged victims were under duress not to make the claims earlier.

Weinstein has been accused of sexual harassment and assault by dozens of women. He denies all allegations of non-consensual sex. The world is watching as this story unfolds, and many are hoping that justice will be served.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed description provided, the message appears to be describing real events and developments involving Harvey Weinstein, Meryl Streep, Jennifer Lawrence, and a class action sexual misconduct lawsuit against Weinstein and his company. The allegations, legal motions, public statements from involved parties, and the overall context are specific and coherent, suggesting it reflects actual news reporting rather than fictional content. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

George Clooney has spoken publicly about his experience of becoming a father to twins, revealing details of their birth and denying that he and his wife Amal used fertility drugs to become pregnant.

In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, the Suburbicon director explained that the couple never discussed children while they were dating and didn't bring it up until after their 2014 wedding. He stated that becoming a parent had never been part of his DNA and that they didn't plan on it.

Clooney and Amal became pregnant in 2016, and he was with her in London when they went to the doctor for an ultrasound. When the doctor told them there were two fetuses, Clooney was surprised and kept thinking there was a mistake. The couple welcomed Alexander and Ella on June 6, a month premature, at St. Mary's Hospital, where Prince William and Kate Middleton's children were born. Alexander was born one minute and 49 seconds before Ella, and Clooney revealed that Alexander weighed five and a half pounds, while Ella weighed four and a half pounds. The twins have dual British and American nationality.

Clooney, who is 56, described his reaction to the birth as "wild." He added that becoming a parent was a sudden realization, and he wanted his children to be happy, have a sense of humor, and be interested in things.

While Clooney admitted that both parents are "unrested" in their new role, he was surprised to find that he was good at changing diapers. He also denied that the couple used fertility drugs to become pregnant, despite speculation that this may have arisen due to Amal's age and the multiple births.

In other news, Clooney is promoting his new film, Suburbicon, a drama set in the late 1950s that he directed and co-wrote with Grant Heslov, starring Matt Damon and Julianne Moore. The Paramount release debuted at the Venice Film Festival on Saturday.

Are you tired of wearing uncomfortable jeans on your next trip? Look no further than these top picks for the best jeans for travel. From denim that's guaranteed to always fit to fleece-lined skinnies, we've got you covered.

Mott & Bow's Slim Grand Jeans are made from a premium 100 percent organic cotton fabric that's hypoallergenic and free from chemicals. The heavyweight fabric offers just the right amount of stretch to be comfortable without being saggy.

Hue's Denim Jeggings are the perfect combination of jeans and leggings. They look and feel like jeans, but offer all the comfort of leggings. The pull-on pants add to the jeans illusion with functional back pockets, faux front pockets, a faux fly, and brushed gold hardware.

L.L. Bean's Fleece-Lined Jeans are perfect for cold-weather destinations. The thin but cozy fleece interior will keep you warm while looking good. The premium stretch denim utilizes the trademarked S Gene technology, which helps the fabric retain its shape through every wear.

Mott & Bow's Slim Boyfriend Ridge Jeans are among the brand's stretchiest, with 23 percent elasticity. The modern fit style is slim without being too skinny and comes in various washes to suit every style.

1822 Denim Butter Bootcut Jeans are made from a fabric so soft that it's called "butter." The ultra-stretchy jeans feel more like jeggings than traditional denim and have five pockets for added convenience.

Spanx's Straight Leg Jeans are perfect for those who hate the feeling of a waistband digging in. The stretchy elastic band in lieu of a button or zippers is comfortable and functional. These normal-looking jeans are equipped with hidden "core-shaping and rear-lifting" technology.

Levi Strauss's pull-on skinny jeans are a cheaper option and come in a wide variety of lengths, sizes, and colors. The jeans feature built-in shapewear and functional pockets.

Everlane's The Original Cheeky Jean is made from an organic cotton and stretch yarn blend and is sustainable. The high rise is nearly 12 inches and the pants are perfect for plus-size travelers.

The Fever High Waist Stash Pocket Jeans boast two snap-closed flap pockets that can conceal your valuables. The soft and stretchy denim pants move with you instead of restricting and are designed to fit perfectly on your next trip.

Good American's Always Fits jeans are so stretchy that they're guaranteed to adapt up to four sizes for the perfect fit, even if you're on a round-the-world trip. These are perfect for plus-size travelers, offering options from size 00 to 32 Plus.

Travel smarter and upgrade your denim game with these top picks for the best jeans for travel.

"You realize your second pregnancy is harder because you have a kid already," Teigen admitted to E! News. "You have to divide your energy between raising a kid and carrying one as well."

But Teigen isn't the only one who believes that second pregnancies can be harder. Many moms of multiple young kids share this sentiment, feeling more tired and drained than they did with their first pregnancy. Add in the responsibility of taking care of another child and the physical and hormonal changes that come with pregnancy, and it's no wonder why some women feel like their second pregnancy is a whole new ball game.

Despite the challenges, Teigen is already thinking ahead to what life will be like with two young children at home. She recently joked that her son will be getting all of his clothes from his sister Luna's hand-me-downs. And while pregnancy can be exhausting, Teigen is doing her best to keep her fans at bay when it comes to her personal decisions and due date.

But when her pregnancy is over, Teigen will have to deal with even more challenges. She's worried that her 2-year-old daughter Luna won't be the best at sharing her toys and attention with her new baby boy. But with plenty of time until her due date in June, Teigen is taking things one day at a time and enjoying every moment of her pregnancy.

Stay tuned for more on Teigen's pregnancy journey and all things parenting on Romper's new video series, Bearing The Motherload. New episodes air Mondays on Facebook.

Chris Evans and Jenny Slate have once again called it quits, according to a sensational report by the New York Times. The couple's on-again, off-again relationship has been the subject of tabloid headlines and social media chatter, but the details of what caused the latest breakup remain unclear.

INSIDER spoke with relationship experts to get to the bottom of why getting back together with an ex is almost always a bad idea. According to April Masini, a relationship expert and online advice forum host, the couple's pattern of breaking up and getting back together is a bad behavioral pattern that can become a source of strain in their daily lives. "Drama replaces problem solving and breakups become a very disruptive part of the relationship dynamic," Masini said.

Susan Winter, another relationship expert and best-selling author, added that reuniting with an ex is typically not worthwhile unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted. "Unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted, restarting an ended relationship is typically not worthwhile," Winter said. "In this case, the issues that appeared to exist (differences in levels of fame and insecurities) didn't change. Love can't conquer everything."

Rachel DeAlto, another relationship expert, agreed that getting back together with an ex is often more trouble than it's worth. "Unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted, restarting an ended relationship is typically not worthwhile," DeAlto said. "In this case, the issues that appeared to exist (differences in levels of fame and insecurities) didn't change. Love can't conquer everything."

Despite these experts' advice, it's possible that Evans and Slate may be following the same line of thinking that has led to their previous breakups. "They're a great odd couple, and Hollywood loves an odd couple romance," Masini said. "And they're not insusceptible to what fans love to see, which makes their issues even tougher."

The good news is that breakups can often lead to positive change. "A breakup can be an enormous motivator to improve ourselves," Winter said. "The clients that come to me and tell me they've lost somebody they love are so incredibly motivated to correct and change things about themselves and their personality."

Whether Evans and Slate will heed this advice remains to be seen, but one thing is for sure: getting back together with an ex is rarely the solution to relationship problems.

On Saturday, March 4, the Southern California Monitoring Association's Twitter account posted that police received a call about a prowler who was allegedly shot at a house believed to belong to reality star Kim Kardashian. The scanner and radio monitoring club's account claimed there was a home invasion and a maid was shot by an unnamed suspect at Kardashian's home. However, the Southern California Monitoring Association later tweeted that the caller disconnected as authorities entered the home, confirming that the call was a false alarm.

The Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) initially told Us Weekly that there was no crime, but later clarified to Us that they did not respond to any call like this on that day. Kim Kardashian's representative also told Us Weekly that the Keeping Up With the Kardashians star was not swatted, and any police calls made on that day had "nothing to do with Kim."

Kris Jenner, Kim Kardashian's mother and a previous victim of swatting calls, tweeted in 2013, "These prank calls are NOT funny! People can get arrested for this! I hope they find out who is behind this. Its dangerous & not a joke!" Swatting calls are hoaxes in which police are deceived and called to a location under false pretenses.

Previous victims of swatting calls include Lil Wayne, Ashton Kutcher, and Justin Bieber.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed investigation and statements from reliable sources such as the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD), Kim Kardashian's representative, and the Southern California Monitoring Association, it is highly likely that the initial message about the incident involving Kim Kardashian was not accurate. Being her wife is the greatest thing I am." Singer Joshua Radin, who performed at the wedding, also took to Instagram to celebrate the union, writing, "Nine years ago today, these two incredible women got married and asked me to sing some of my songs to them while they were celebrating their most special day. It‚Äôs still one of the most fun things I‚Äôve ever done. Happy anniversary @theellenshow and @portiaderossi."

In an interview with Oprah Winfrey, de Rossi recalled how she fell for DeGeneres. "We actually met socially and I just felt that immediate draw," she said. "We did talk a little bit and then over those three years, we saw each other at parties or at various things, but the one time that was the most significant was during a photoshoot actually." She continued, "I just walked over to say hello to her, and I couldn‚Äôt believe it, but she turned around and it was like an arrow was shot through my heart. I felt weak at the knees and I was overwhelmed with how I felt, but then it took me about 10 months to get the courage up to actually do anything about it." The couple first announced their plans to marry in a 2008 episode of DeGeneres' talk show, following the news that the California Supreme Court had struck down a law banning same-sex marriage. The internet is a vast and ever-changing place, full of moments that capture the attention of millions and become a part of our collective consciousness. From the dress that divided the world to the "hot felon" who became a global sensation, these are the moments that broke the internet in a way that no other could.

The dress that divided the world

On February 26, 2015, a tweet featuring a close-up photo of a dress went viral, sparking a heated debate about its color. The dress was actually a blue and black bandage dress from British retailer Roman Originals, but people saw it as gold and white or blue and black. The debate raged on for days, with 7.6 million tweets and a surge in traffic to Roman Originals' site. The retailer sold out of the original black and gold dress in 34 minutes and eventually sold a white and gold version in support of British charity Comic Relief.

April the Giraffe's birth

In the spring of 2017, all eyes were on April, a pregnant giraffe at Animal Adventure Park in Harpursville, New York. The live-streaming camera set up in April's habitat captivated viewers as she gave birth to calf Tajiri on April 15, 2017. The live stream garnered more than 232 million live views on YouTube over a seven-week period.

The "yanny" or "laurel" debate

In May 2018, a bizarre recording of the word "laurel" split the internet in two. While some heard the word "laurel," others clearly heard "yanny," and nobody could agree on who was right. The audio clip was from an online dictionary entry, and the differing interpretations of the clip all had to do with how the brain interprets sound frequencies.

Jeremy Meeks, the "hot felon"

In June 2014, the Stockton Police Department released a mugshot of Jeremy Meeks, a 30-year-old inmate arrested on a weapons charge. Meeks' chiseled jaw and piercing eyes quickly made him a global sensation, and he was dubbed the "hot felon." Meeks signed to a modeling agency and has since worked around the world.

Beyonc√©'s pregnancy announcement

When Beyonc√© makes an announcement, the world stops to listen, and her early morning pregnancy announcement was no different. Pregnant with twins, Queen Beyonc√© posted a photo to Instagram in the wee hours of February 1, 2017, announcing that the Carter-Knowles family was "blessed two times over" and would be growing their family by two. The announcement post earned more than 11 million likes, making it one of the most-liked Instagram posts of all time.

Trump's "covfefe" tweet

On May 31, 2017, President Trump tweeted, "Despite the constant negative press covfefe." A screenshot of the now-deleted tweet shows Trump's use of "covfefe" in an apparent typo. The word became a catchphrase of sorts that spawned T-shirts, hashtags, and even a license plate. The baffling term even lent its name to a legislative proposal from U.S. Rep Mike Quigley. If enacted, the COVFEFE Act (Communications Over Various Feeds Electronically for Engagement Act) would have required the National Archives to keep records of the president's tweets.

Kim Kardashian's Paper magazine cover

In 2017, Kim Kardashian's bare-all cover of Paper magazine brought the phrase "break the internet" into the public lexicon. The magazine unveiled two covers shot by Jean-Paul Goude that feature the reality star, including one where she bares all. In the second photo, a recreation Goude's "Champagne Incident" photograph from the 1960s, Kardashian is popping open a bottle of champagne that has fountained over her head and into a glass balanced on her derriere.

Dwyane Wade, the star of the Miami Heat, has become one of the most highly paid basketball players in the world. With estimated net worths of over $100 million, it's hard to imagine the amount of hard work and dedication that has gone into his success.

But what exactly does Wade make his money from? The answer is simple: basketball and massive paychecks. Since joining the NBA in 2003-2004, Wade has made over $136 million playing the game he loves. His current contract pays him $15 million this season, with another $16.1 million due next season if he opts-in to his player option.

But Wade's success doesn't stop there. Along with LeBron James, Wade has mastered the art of taking short-term contracts to increase his flexibility and secure larger annual contracts. In 2014, he signed a two-year, $31.1 million contract with a player option, setting him up to be a free agent when the salary cap increases in 2016-2017. And when that time comes, Wade will be set to cash in on the biggest paydays of his career.

However, even with all of his accomplishments, Wade was only the 21st highest-paid player in the NBA last year, according to ESPN. He made far less than players like Joe Johnson, Rudy Gay, and Brook Lopez. But that's not reason to feel bad for Wade, though. He's made tens of millions more in sponsorship deals, including a high-profile deal with a sports brand in China.

Over the years, Wade has had sponsorship deals with Converse and Nike, but his biggest deal was with Chinese shoe company Li Ning. In 2012, he signed a 10-year deal with the company that few consumers know in the U.S., but which will pay him millions annually along with a reported $60 million stake in the company. It was a high-risk move for both Li Ning and Wade, and it's uncertain if it's paying off. Li Ning just reported its third straight year of losses, and its stock has gone almost nowhere since Wade signed the deal.

On top of Li Ning, Wade has had slightly less lucrative deals with Gatorade, Pepperidge Farm, Mission, and other brands. In total, Forbes estimates that he made $12 million in sponsorships last year.

Add it all up, and Dwyane Wade has made well over $200 million in his career. But after paying agents, managers, and living expenses, his net worth is likely significantly less than that. Estimates of his net worth are between $95 million and $115 million, and he has millions more coming in future years.

No matter how you look at it, Dwyane Wade has built a huge net worth and he'll likely add to it in years to come. And for those who have followed his career, it's clear that his success is a testament to his hard work, dedication, and willingness to take risks.

Drew Scott, the beloved star of TLC's "The Property Brothers," has officially tied the knot with his partner, Scott Brothers Global creative director Linda Phan. The couple exchanged vows in a breathtaking outdoor ceremony on the Italian coast, surrounded by 300 guests from all corners of the world.

The newlyweds, who have been together for years, described their wedding day as the most magical moment of their lives. They were overjoyed to be surrounded by loved ones in a beautiful setting, and expressed their gratitude for the countless blessings that had come their way.

The week-long celebration began with bachelor and bachelorette excursions, including a bicycle tour and cooking classes. The festivities culminated in a stunning Apulian-style welcome party, complete with artisan booths and delicious food.

Drew and Linda's wedding was a true reflection of their personalities and shared love for adventure. They exchanged custom wedding bands and were dressed in kilts by Claymore Imports. The ceremony was designed by Oany Ravelo, and the reception was held in a stunning outdoor venue.

For their first dance, the couple surprised guests with a choreographed routine by their "Dancing with the Stars" partner, Emma Slater. The wedding party included Drew's brothers, Jonathan and J.D., who served as the best men, and Linda had 10 bridesmaids.

In lieu of a registry, Drew and Linda partnered with the non-profit ME to WE to tie their wedding with their passion for providing clean water to people in need around the world. They gifted each of their 300 guests with travel bags designed by Lug, as well as custom pizza cutters and plates created by Fortessa, the manufacturer of their Scott Living line.

Drew and Linda's wedding was a true celebration of love and compassion. They can't wait to see what the future holds for them and expressed their excitement for the next chapter of their lives. "I'm most looking forward to spending more time together," Drew said. "We've been working so hard for so long, I'm looking forward to making plans to settle down and just enjoy doing nothing once in a while."

"Property Brothers: Linda & Drew Say I Do" will premiere on June 2 at 9/8c on TLC. For more details and photos from the wedding, pick up the issue of PEOPLE on newsstands on May 18, and watch PeopleTV's exclusive special, "People Weddings: Drew Scott and Linda Phan," on Wednesday, May 16 on PeopleTV.com or download the app on your favorite mobile or connected device.

On a warm February day, I visited Georgina Chapman's West Village townhouse to interview her. Upon arrival, I discovered that the parlor floor, despite the unseasonable heat outside, was warmed by a roaring fire. As I waited, I realized that I was sitting in Harvey Weinstein's living room. He had purchased the six-story house in 2006, before marrying Chapman, and she had since transformed it with her style. The black floors and white rugs, chinoiserie, gilt, and glass, hydrangeas in a vase, and a Jo Malone candle completed the ambiance.

A few weeks earlier, I had met Chapman at the Marchesa fashion company atelier, where she co-owns the business with Keren Craig. She appeared nervous and uncomfortable, mentioning that she had not been out in public for five months since similar accusations against her husband were made public. Today, she was more relaxed, though there was a sense of gallows humor. When I mentioned the warm weather, she quipped, "Think of all the poor plants that are going to spring out and then die."

We moved downstairs to the ground floor, which was a large, open space with modern furniture and surprising art. There was a spacious kitchen that overlooked the backyard, and a TV room where Chapman's son Dash was sitting on a sectional encircled by some kind of electronic device. At 42, Chapman looked younger than in photographs, perhaps because she was more goofy than I had imagined. Although she retained her British accent, she was more laid-back than I had expected.

Our meeting took place in Chapman's soon-to-be-ex-townhouse that had recently been sold by her soon-to-be-ex-husband. It was meant to be the first time she publicly addressed what happened with her husband. However, the night before our meeting, she called me late and sounded worried, apologetic, and unsure of whether she was ready to address difficult questions. I reassured her that we could discuss topics unrelated to her marriage to Weinstein. During our meeting, we primarily discussed her life before her marriage to Weinstein and her fashion company Marchesa.

Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

During the event, King joked about Stone's portrayal of her in the film, stating, "Emma, thanks for making me look so good." Stone, who had never played a real-life character before, expressed her admiration for King, saying, "Capturing the essence was very important to us. It was super challenging, but [King] was so warm and welcoming and open to all of it. She was generous with her story that it made it much easier than if she was like, 'Please don't make this movie about me, good night.'"

King met everyone involved in the film before it began shooting, but directors Jonathan Dayton and Valerie Faris (who are also married) kept the actors apart to ensure that Stone could properly embody King's essence. King even met with Carell and Stone at the afterparty, which was sponsored by FIJI.

Battle of the Sexes is set to be released in theaters on Friday.

The inclusion of specific names, events, and quotes typically found in such contexts strongly suggest the authenticity of the message. Therefore, I would return **1** as it is more likely to be a real message.

When asked about the possibility of appearing on the show, Colletti initially seemed open to the idea, saying, "I'm a single man. Yes, so The Bachelor season 47." However, he later clarified that he would not be going on any group dates, adding, "No I wouldn't [go on The Bachelor]. I think we've handled enough reality TV on this end."

When asked if he would consider going on the show with former One Tree Hill costar James Lafferty, Colletti joked, "We hand out the roses. Just the rose holder. You [Lafferty] come in not saying anything. That looks like Nathan Scott, James Lafferty. He's on The Bachelor?! "

Colletti is currently working on his new show, Everyone is Doing Great, and has recently enlisted the help of former One Tree Hill costars Sophia Bush and Antwon Tanner. Lafferty revealed that he is "respectfully spoken for" in the dating department, while Colletti is still looking for a partner. With a passion for Formula 1 racing that began in his childhood, Fassbender has logged over 120 hours behind the wheel of his 488 Ferrari Challenge car, a high-performance vehicle worth $330,000.

Fassbender, who picked up racing in 2016, has proven to be a dedicated and talented competitor, according to Didier Theys, the head instructor of the Ferrari Challenge. Fassbender has won the first of six races in the 2018 season, which began at Florida's Daytona Speedway in January.

Racing is a reward for Fassbender, who has been nominated for two Oscars for his work in the films "12 Years a Slave" and "Steve Jobs." He admits that racing is more fun than learning lines for movies, but there are also significant differences between the two.

Fassbender notes that racing requires a different kind of focus and composure, as the mind cannot wander while driving at high speeds. He has also learned to embrace his anxiety before races, describing it as a "special feeling."

Over time, Fassbender has come to understand that winning is the allure of racing, just as it is for many competitors. He aims to be "fastest or you're not," and is determined to win each race.

Leonardo DiCaprio Joins Forces with Celebrities to Donate $1 Million to Hurricane Harvey Relief Efforts

In a stunning show of generosity, Leonardo DiCaprio has joined the ranks of other celebrities who have donated to the Hurricane Harvey relief efforts. The Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation has donated a whopping $1 million to the newly established United Way Harvey Recovery Fund, which will be used to support short and long-term relief and recovery efforts for those affected by the devastating hurricane.

This generous donation from the Oscar-winning actor and his foundation marks the inaugural contribution to the fund and is the latest in a series of disaster relief efforts supported by the DiCaprio Foundation. In the past, the foundation has donated to recovery efforts following the 2004 tsunami, the Haiti earthquake, and Hurricane Sandy.

"We are incredibly grateful for the generosity of Leonardo DiCaprio and his foundation," said United Way Worldwide President and CEO Brian Gallagher in a statement. "Responding to Hurricane Harvey requires the best of all of us - and that's what this gift represents."

United Way is the world's largest privately-funded non-profit organization and anticipates that Harvey recovery efforts will take several years. The $1 million donation from DiCaprio's foundation will be used to support these efforts.

Many other celebrities have also stepped up to help out, including Sandra Bullock, who donated $1 million to the American Red Cross on Tuesday. Beyonce, Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, DJ Khaled, and Kevin Hart have also donated to the cause. Johnson, Khaled, and Hart each donated $25,000 to Harvey relief, with Kevin Hart challenging other celebrities to do the same.

If you would like to help out, you can do so by donating to the United Way Harvey Recovery Fund or by volunteering your time to support the relief efforts in any way you can.
td_rationale:
Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real and verifiable news article rather than fictitious or misleading information. The details are specific, mentioning Leonardo DiCaprio's foundation and its donation of $1 million to the United Way Harvey Recovery Fund. The involvement of other celebrities like Sandra Bullock, Beyonce, Dwayne Johnson, DJ Khaled, and Kevin Hart in similar efforts adds credibility, as these are verifiable public figures known for charitable contributions. The statement from United Way's President further supports the authenticity of DiCaprio's donation. Therefore, the message is likely to be real.

**Veracity prediction: 1**

Celine Dion Returns to the Stage in Las Vegas Just Days After Mass Shooting

In a heartwarming and emotional move, legendary singer Celine Dion took to the stage in Las Vegas on Tuesday night, just two days after the city and the country were left reeling from the deadliest mass shooting in modern American history.

Dion, who has two long-running residencies in Vegas, made a poignant statement ahead of her show, saying that proceeds from the night would go to the victims of Sunday's shooting at the Route 91 Harvest Festival and their families.

‚ÄúTonight is very different,‚Äù Dion said, according to videos taken by fans. ‚ÄúAfter Sunday night‚Äôs incredibly tragic event, all of us here find ourselves asking a similar question. For you, it‚Äôs, ‚ÄòDo we still go to Celine‚Äôs show on Tuesday night, only two days after the nightmare?‚Äô For me, it‚Äôs, ‚ÄòCan I still do my show? Should I still do my show only two days after the nightmare?‚Äô These are difficult questions.‚Äù

Despite the emotional weight of the situation, Dion ultimately decided to go on with her performances ‚Äúto show love and support for those who are affected.‚Äù

‚ÄúOn Sunday, we lost too many beautiful, innocent souls and so many are still suffering. But tonight, we are going to let these families know that we are supporting them and that we will help them through their tragic loss,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey are going to need a lot of love, a ton of emotional support, as well as a great deal of financial aid.‚Äù

Her announcement that proceeds would be donated drew more than 30 seconds of applause from the crowd.

Dion also dedicated the show to the victims, their families, first responders, and doctors and nurses ‚Äúwho are working around the clock to save lives.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want you to know that you have made the right choice in being here tonight,‚Äù she said.

In the aftermath of Sunday's shooting, which killed 58 and injured more than 500, fellow Vegas-based performer Jennifer Lopez canceled her shows through October 7, according to a statement obtained by Variety.

Jason Aldean, who was on stage when the shooting began, also canceled his shows through October 12.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific account provided in the message, including quotes attributed to Celine Dion and mentions of actions taken by other performers such as Jennifer Lopez and Jason Aldean, the message appears to be more likely to be a real account rather than fabricated. The inclusion of specific details like the dedication of proceeds, reactions from the audience, and comparisons to other performers' responses adds credibility to the narrative. Therefore, I would predict the veracity of the message as 1 (real message).
cs_rationale: I predict the veracity of this message to be 1. Celine Dion's return to the in Las Vegas just days after the mass shooting seems to be a real and credible event, multiple sources have reported on it, including statements from fans and media outlets. The weight of the situation and her decision to continue with her performances despite the tragedy demonstrates a sense of support for those affected by the shooting. Therefore, based on these details, it is more likely that this message is real.

On October 23, 2002, Kanye West was involved in a serious car accident in Los Angeles. At the time, he was mostly known for his production work and had not yet gained widespread recognition as a rapper. However, this accident would ultimately inspire one of his most successful songs, "Through the Wire."

According to West himself, he was working late at night in the studio with Beanie Sigel, Peedi Crack, and The Black Eyed Peas when he was cut off by another vehicle and collided with a car just blocks away from the W Hotel. The accident left him with a broken jaw and required reconstructive surgery.

Despite having no health insurance, West paid for all of his medical expenses out of pocket. He spent several weeks in the hospital and was unable to work or produce music during this time.

After his release from the hospital, West returned to the studio and created "Through the Wire," a song he rapped with a broken jaw. The song was eventually released on his debut mixtape, Get Well Soon, in early 2003.

Despite not receiving much label support at the time, West's "Through the Wire" eventually became a hit and helped propel him to stardom. The song was the first single off of his classic debut album, College Dropout, which was released on February 10, 2004. Since then, Kanye West has become one of the most successful and influential rappers of his generation.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed narrative provided about Kanye West's car accident in 2002 and its aftermath leading to the creation of "Through the Wire," the message appears to be factual and coherent. It provides specific details such as the circumstances of the accident, Kanye West's injuries, his recovery process, and the subsequent creation and impact of the song on his career. These details are consistent with known accounts and historical records of Kanye West's early career trajectory. Therefore, I assess the veracity of the message as 1 (real).
cs_rationale:
Based on the details provided in the message, it is likely to be a real account of events surrounding Kanye West's car accident and the subsequent creation of his song "Through the Wire." These specifics, along with the fact that "Through the Wire" is a well-known song that recounts his experience of rapping with a wired jaw, are consistent with widely reported facts about Kanye West's early career.

Furthermore, the narrative aligns with Kanye West's own public statements and biographical details that have been well-documented in various sources. The story of overcoming adversity and using personal experiences to fuel creative output is also in line with common themes found in celebrity biographies and music industry narratives.

Therefore, based on the information presented and considering the details provided, I would predict the veracity of this message as 1, indicating that it is more likely to be a real account of Kanye West's experience.

The Met Gala, a fashion event that has become a highlight of the year, was abruptly postponed before it even began. On March 16, the Met Gala was indefinitely postponed, following the same fate as the 2002 event, which was cancelled due to the 9/11 attacks.

The Met Gala, also known as the Oscars of the East, is an annual event held on the first Monday in May, celebrating the Metropolitan Museum of Art's latest exhibition at the Costume Institute. Last year's theme, "Camp: Notes on Fashion," featured over 200 pieces from high-end designers such as Alexander McQueen and Karl Lagerfeld, and this year's theme, "About Time: Fashion and Duration," was set to be sponsored by Louis Vuitton and Cond√© Nast.

Jennifer Holliday, a Tony-winning Broadway star, has announced that she will no longer be participating in the presidential inauguration celebration next week. Her decision comes after backlash from her fans, who felt that her participation would be interpreted as a statement of support for President-elect Donald Trump.

Holliday, best known for her role in the hit musical "Dreamgirls," faced pressure from the gay, lesbian, and black communities when it was announced that she would sing at a concert on Thursday at Washington's Lincoln Memorial. In a statement released on Saturday, she apologized for her lapse of judgment and for any heartbreak she may have caused to her fans.

Several other prominent entertainers have also declined to perform at Trump's inauguration festivities. Country star Toby Keith and actor Jon Voight are among those who have agreed to participate in the concert.

Holliday's decision to withdraw from the event was first reported by The Wrap, which obtained a letter that she wrote to her fans. Her representative, Bill Carpenter, confirmed the details in the letter to the Associated Press.

In the letter, Holliday wrote, "My only choice must now be to stand with the LGBT Community and to state unequivocally that I WILL NOT PERFORM FOR THE WELCOME CONCERT OR FOR ANY OF THE INAUGURATION FESTIVITIES!" She added, "Please know that I HEAR YOU and I feel your pain. The LGBT Community was mostly responsible for birthing my career and I am deeply indebted to you."

Holliday had been scheduled to perform at the "Make America Great Again! Welcome Celebration," which also included Toby Keith and Jon Voight. The event is part of Trump's inauguration festivities, which will take place on Friday, January 20th.

Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message, and the prediction is 1.

content:
[April the giraffe is pregnant again! Get ready for the cutest baby giraffe of the year. (Photo: Animal Adventure Park)

After months of suspense and anticipation, Animal Adventure Park owner Jordan Patch finally revealed the big news: April the giraffe is expecting another baby calf.

Last month, the park sent 30 days worth of fecal samples to another zoo's laboratory for progesterone testing to confirm the pregnancy, 14 months after April gave birth to her calf, Tajiri.

Keeper Allysa Swilley collected a fecal sample from April's stall over the course of a month. The samples were secured in plastic bags, labeled and dated before being put in freezer storage.

April is months into her pregnancy and due to give birth in early spring 2019, park officials said.

Last year, Southern Tier residents and others from around the nation and world watched, captivated, as the heavily pregnant giraffe captivated audiences on the park's live stream during the final weeks of her pregnancy.

On April 15, 2017, more than a million viewers tuned in to watch April give birth to a healthy, male calf named Tajiri.

‚ÄúApril‚Äôs prior pregnancy facilitated an immeasurable amount of education and appreciation for giraffes," Patch said in a news release. "We‚Äôre very proud of our captive management and propagation program and eager to continue doing all we can to help bring this species awareness and tangible results towards conservation.‚Äù

Fans will once again be able to follow April's progress throughout her pregnancy on social media, the park said.

The Duchess of Cambridge, also known as Kate Middleton, is a member of the British royal family and has been married to Prince William since 2011. The couple has three children together.

Prince William is second in line to the throne after his father, Prince Charles. If Charles becomes King, both the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge will move up the line of succession. Prince William is expected to become the Prince of Wales and Kate will be styled as the Princess of Wales, a title that was last held by her late mother, Princess Diana.

When William takes the throne, Kate will become the Queen Consort, a title that has only been held by male consorts in the past. However, Kate will not be referred to as the Queen of England, and will only hold the title of Queen Consort. Princess Charlotte, who is fourth in line to the throne, has the potential to hold the title of Queen, if she is born before her older brother.

Kate Middleton's current title is Her Royal Highness the Duchess of Cambridge, a title that she assumes from her husband. When William becomes King, it is widely expected that Kate will assume the title of Queen Consort, but it is possible that she will be referred to as Queen or Queen Catherine.

The media landscape surrounding the White House has been transformed by a president who has been vocal in his criticism of the press. The question remains as to whether this approach is both fair and dangerous. To discuss this topic, we have invited David Folkenflik, media correspondent for NPR and co-host of On Point, Olivier Knox, president of the White House Correspondents Association and chief Washington correspondent for Sirius XM radio, and Mona Charen, syndicated columnist and author of "Sex Matters: How Modern Feminism Lost Touch With Science, Love, and Common Sense."

David Folkenflik believes that the media's coverage of the White House has become more adversarial under President Trump's leadership. He notes that the president's attacks on the media have led to a more confrontational dynamic, which has in turn led to a reduction in the quality of journalism.

Olivier Knox agrees that the relationship between the media and the White House has become more strained under Trump's presidency. He believes that the president's constant criticism of the press has created a situation where the media is more likely to report negatively on the president and his administration.

Mona Charen argues that the media's role as a watchdog is important, and that the president's attacks on the press are an attempt to undermine this function. She believes that the media's ability to hold the administration accountable is essential to ensuring a healthy democracy.

Overall, it seems that the relationship between the media and the White House has become more contentious under President Trump's leadership. While some argue that this is necessary to ensure a free press, others believe that it is dangerous and undermines the media's ability to hold the administration accountable.

content:
I had just downed a few drinks and spotted her sitting at the table, and I couldn't resist the urge to go say hi. "Rihanna's over there, let me go say hi, she knows me, we're homegirls," I mumbled around the 1:50 mark. And I approached her, only to tap her lightly on the shoulder. To my surprise, she was incredibly friendly and kind, and I was left speechless. "Hey girl, good to see you!" she said with a smile. My heart was pounding, and I stuttered, "Uh...oh...we're...uh..." and excused myself, unable to contain my excitement. I walked away, feeling like I had blown any chance of becoming her best friend, all because of my drunken nervousness and starstruck-ness.

This encounter will likely not be the last time our paths cross, as Rae is set to write and star in a Twitter-conceived heist film with Lupita Nyong'o and Rihanna. In the meantime, we share a commonality‚Äîboth of us have been pursued by Drake. While Rihanna has made it clear she has no interest in the Toronto rapper, Rae once again stated she did not turn him down at the Golden Globes.

One night, as I was heading to the HBO party, Drake was leaving the HBO party. We crossed paths, and he said the most magical words ever. "I've been looking for you all night," he said. "You talking about me?" I asked, my heart racing. "I'm about to go to this Netflix party, do you want to go?" he replied. "Oh, I have to go, stop in the HBO party," I said, because they're the network that puts my show on. "I couldn't just ditch the party and go to Netflix party even though that's what I really wanted to do. So I said, 'I'll catch you at that party.' And that was it. I went to the party, and all of a sudden blogs were reporting that I turned him down, which would never happen.

Thankfully, that didn't stop me from appearing in Drake's "Nice for What" video alongside other famous women, which I called a "dream come true."

As for my critically-acclaimed HBO series Insecure, I told Colbert that my mom stopped watching after a few racy scenes in season 2. Season 3 is set to begin this Sunday at 10:30 p.m., and I'm sure there will be more scenes that will make my mom cringe.
td_rationale: The message seems to be a first-person account of an encounter with Rihanna and Drake. It contains specific details and emotions that make it sound like a real experience. content:
"Moore's War on Yoga Pants: 'I Want Montana to Be Known as a Decent State!'"

In a shocking statement, controversial figure and Montana Governor, Greg Gianforte, has declared that yoga pants should be illegal in public. According to the Associated Press, Moore made the bold claim, "I want Montana to be known as a decent state."

Despite Moore's bizarre stance, the U.S. sales for yoga clothes have increased an astounding 45 percent year over year, while participation in yoga sports has only increased by a measly 4.5 percent. This means that more and more women are embracing athleisure wear as their go-to uniform, and for good reason - yoga pants are versatile, seasonless, and most importantly, comfortable.

But just because yoga pants are comfortable, doesn't mean they should be worn anywhere and everywhere. Here are some tips on how to wear yoga pants around town without getting the side-eye:

DO: Learn from Lululemon's sheer pants recall. Make sure you select a pair that is truly opaque. Test them out in broad daylight or under bright lights.

DON'T: Wear them to work. Ever. "Dress Pant Yoga Pants" is an oxymoron.

DO: Invest in the correct size. It sounds like a no-brainer, but often women will purchase a size down to get a tighter fit or a longer shelf life since yoga pants stretch out. In reality, all you end up with is "camel toe." Avoid at all costs.

DON'T: Show your panty lines. If thongs aren't your thing, Commando and Zobha make great full-coverage bikini bottoms that are undetectable.

DO: Layer up! Throwing on a leather jacket or a dark trench over your yoga pants and T-shirt will instantly dress up your look when you're running from bikram to brunch.

DON'T: Keep wearing your favorite pair after the expiration date. Unlike jeans, yoga pants don't age well. Toss them when they're overly faded, stretched or ripped.

DO: Accessorize! Nothing pulls together athleisure wear like a statement handbag and a pair of sunglasses.

DON'T: Try to pull off your zaniest tie-dye yoga pants outside your ashtanga class. Stock up on neutral colors ‚Äî navy, black, charcoal ‚Äî that will go with anything.

DO: Consider your tight-fitting yoga pants a thicker alternative to leggings in the wintertime. On the weekends, pair with knee-high boots and an oversized sweater, or wear them underneath a dress. No one will know the difference.

To shop the best yoga pants on the market, click on the slideshow below.
td_rationale: This message seems like a satirical or joking take on a hypothetical statement made by the Montana Governor, Greg Gianforte, about banning yoga pants in public. The message also provides tips on how to wear yoga pants without getting negative attention, but the overall tone suggests that it's a humorous exaggeration rather than a genuine declaration. Therefore, the veracity of this message is low, and it is more likely to be an exaggerated or satirical piece. Predicted veracity: 0
cs_rationale:

1. **Greg Gianforte as Governor**: While Greg Gianforte was indeed Governor of Montana, the extreme stance against yoga pants seems exaggerated and not aligned with typical political discourse.

2. **Bizarre and Extreme Claims**: The statement about wanting Montana to be known as a "decent state" due to banning yoga pants in public is highly unusual and provocative, which is often characteristic of satire or parody.

3. **Contradictory Sales and Participation Figures**: The statistics provided (45% increase in yoga clothes sales vs. 4.5% increase in yoga participation) seem oddly specific and not typically found in serious news reports. They also serve to exaggerate the scenario.

4. **Style and Tone**: The article's style, with tips on wearing yoga pants and a casual tone about athleisure wear, resembles lifestyle or fashion advice rather than serious political or societal commentary.

The Mad Max: Fury Road star, Charlize Theron, is set to make a comeback with her new action film, Atomic Blonde. But little does she know, her career almost took a different turn. Following her Best Actress Oscar win for 2003‚Äôs Monster, Theron was offered plenty of roles in action movies, but none of them quite fit her desired image of a no-nonsense female assassin. That is, until she came across the opportunity to work with director Karyn Kusama on Aeon Flux.

‚ÄúI got offered a lot of stuff in action movies that was either the girl behind the computer or the wife,‚Äù Theron revealed to Variety magazine. ‚ÄúWhen Aeon Flux came to me, I thought that could be something. I was never completely sold on the entire concept, but I really loved Karyn Kusama‚Äôs movie (Girlfight). So I threw myself into that with the belief that she‚Äôs a great filmmaker.‚Äù

Unfortunately, their collaboration did not yield the desired results. The film received a lukewarm reception from critics and failed to make a significant impact at the box office. ‚ÄúAnd then we f**ked it all up,‚Äù Theron joked. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt think we really knew how to execute it. And it‚Äôs disappointing, but it happens. I‚Äôve been in this business long enough to know that you cannot get it right every time.‚Äù

Despite the setback, Theron was determined to take on the role of Lorraine Broughton in Atomic Blonde. And, after reading the script, she was immediately drawn to the character. ‚ÄúI might have gotten this right because of that (Aeon Flux),‚Äù Theron smiled. ‚ÄúYou know nothing about this woman. It‚Äôs so rare that a female gets that in a movie.‚Äù

Finally, Theron has the opportunity to play the perfect female protagonist, a tough as nails spy, and she‚Äôs convinced that Atomic Blonde will be a hit among fans and critics alike. The actress is eager to show the world what she‚Äôs capable of and hopes that her fans will be just as excited as she is to see her take on this new challenge.

LOS ANGELES (AP) ‚Äî The legal team of Harvey Weinstein has filed a sensational motion to dismiss Ashley Judd's lawsuit against the disgraced movie mogul, accusing her of filing her sexual harassment allegations far too late and making baseless claims against him.

In a shocking move, Weinstein's lawyers argued that Judd's comment that she would only let Weinstein touch her after she won an Academy Award in one of his films was just a "mock bargain" she made in order to leave after he asked her for a massage in a Beverly Hills hotel room 22 years ago.

Judd's attorneys countered that the comment was just a "mock bargain" she made to leave the hotel room after Weinstein's inappropriate advances, but Weinstein's team claimed that it meant Judd acknowledged that Weinstein would try to get her movie roles.

The attorneys also argued that Judd's sexual harassment allegations, even if true, fall far short of being "unwelcome and pervasive or severe," as the law requires for a finding in her favor. They claimed that Weinstein's alleged unwanted sexual advances occurred on a single day and consisted of asking her to give him a massage, asking her to help him pick out clothes, and asking her to watch him shower.

In response to the motion to dismiss, Judd's attorney Theodore Boutrous Jr. said that "Mr. Weinstein's arguments seeking to escape the consequences of his despicable misconduct are not only baseless, they are offensive."

Judd, 50, was among the first women to go public with allegations against Weinstein, who faces criminal sexual assault charges in New York and has been named in several other sexual harassment lawsuits.

On Wednesday, newly-elected US Senator Kamala Harris met with nearly two dozen agriculture and water officials from the Central Valley to discuss ways to ensure a more reliable source of water for the region. The meeting was intended to ease the typically strained relationship between Democratic leaders from urban areas and the Republican-dominated Central Valley.

During the roundtable, Ryan Jacobsen, executive director of the Fresno County Farm Bureau, emphasized the need for federal and state action to protect the area's water supply. Jason Phillips, CEO of the Friant Water Authority, noted that recent rainfall had not solved the long-standing problem of nearly a decade of drought. He also mentioned that a canal that runs from Fresno to north of Bakersfield had sunk in some places as much as 2 feet in two years, causing issues with the system that operates on the force of gravity.

The meeting was also an opportunity for Harris to convince Central Valley representatives of her interest in issues beyond her base in Alameda and San Francisco counties. Harris is seeking to be more like Sen. Dianne Feinstein, who has worked for two decades to aid the agricultural industry. However, Harris' predecessor, former Sen. Barbara Boxer, was more aligned with environmental groups, which has led to a negative view of her in the Central Valley.

Some participants lobbied Harris for her support of dams that have long been under consideration by federal and state officials, particularly the Temperance Flat Dam, which would be constructed on the San Joaquin River. Harris offered no assurances on the topic, and speaking to reporters after the meeting, she said she would advocate for farmers during the crafting of a new farm bill and other measures before the Senate.

William Bourdeau, executive vice president of the influential Harris Farms, wished that Harris' urban supporters had a "better understanding" of the risks and challenges of farming. Harris replied that she agreed with him completely.

The inclusion of quotes from participants and specific issues discussed at the roundtable further supports the veracity of the message. cs_rationale: Given the level of detail and the specifics of the discussions, it is highly likely that this message is real. Therefore, my prediction for its veracity is 1.

You just feel rotten and you're not allowed to say why," she confessed to Fallon. "I was filming quite a lot and just inadvertently falling asleep all the time. It was just embarrassing."

Even worse, Danes accidentally "face planted" onto a crocheted bag and left with a "third degree burn" on her face. "I have this crocheted indentation all on the side of my face. It looked like I had third degree burns," she revealed. "They were massaging my face. They had to get out the blow dryer. I halted production for a good half an hour. I felt like an idiot."

Despite all the drama, Danes is now in the "cruisy second trimester" and can't wait for her second child to move and kick. "It gets a little excited when I have a chocolate bar. It's moving and kicking," she said. "I love that part. It's like a fireworks show every so often. It's really cool and a little creepy. The House of Representatives recently passed a health care bill aimed at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare). The bill passed with a narrow margin, 217-213, and was met with criticism from numerous Hollywood stars who took to Twitter to voice their opinions against the bill.

The Republican-backed measure will keep children on family policies until age 26 but will also cut the Medicaid program for low-income people and end tax penalties in the Affordable Care Act on the health industry and those who earn high-paying salaries. The bill will also block federal payments to Planned Parenthood for a year and allows states to get waivers to free insurers from coverage requirements, which could cause them to charge people with pre-existing illnesses higher rates than they charge healthy customers.

In response to the bill's passage, President Trump expressed confidence in the bill's success and stated that it was a repeal and replace of Obamacare. However, many people, including Jimmy Kimmel and George Takei, expressed their views on equal healthcare for those with pre-existing conditions, such as their newborn son.

The hashtag #IAmAPreexistingCondition quickly became a trending topic, and America Ferrera, Sarah Hyland, Mark Ruffalo, and George Takei were among those who expressed their views on Twitter. The bill now heads to the Senate, where its fate is uncertain.

The level of detail and the specific references to public figures and trending hashtags suggest that the message is more likely to be real.

However, she did not mention Lauren Conrad or Whitney Port, who are both also pregnant with their first children. It seems that Kristin has a special bond with Audrina, as she revealed that when Audrina was pregnant, she reached out to her for advice and support.

"When Audrina was pregnant, she reached out a lot and asked me some questions, like what pregnancy jeans I liked, and that kind of stuff," said Kristin. "I've talked to her since she's had the baby, and she sounds like she's just loving life."

Kristin is also very close to Heidi, who is married to Spencer Pratt. In fact, she put together a list of different products and toys that she had loved and sent that over to Heidi. "I put together a little list of different products and toys that I've loved and sent that over to her," said Kristin.

Being a mother is a lot of work, especially when your boys are as rambunctious as Kristin's. "My boys are so close in age, so one minute they're best friends and one minute they're hitting each other, punching each other," she said. "They get very violent with each other...I think just right now, that's the hardest part."

Despite the challenges, Kristin is grateful for her beautiful family. "They're so sweet, they're incredibly loving, and they love to cuddle and they love their mommy. And that's the best feeling in the entire world," she said.

Kristin also revealed that her daughter, Saylor, is a "diva" who loves to roughhouse and is very different from her brothers. "She's a diva, but she's a ton of fun...She may as well be another boy because she's the third so she wants to do whatever the boys are doing. She's pretty tough," said Kristin.

In conclusion, Kristin Cavallari is not only a stunning mother and fashion icon, but she is also a kind and supportive friend to many of her costars. Her love for her family and her dedication to being a mother are truly inspiring.

Smith, 46, explained that she has undergone several tests to determine the cause of her hair loss, which has been a source of concern for her. While some professionals have suggested that stress may be the cause, others have suggested that she has alopecia, an autoimmune skin disease that can cause hair loss.

Smith admitted that the thought of losing her hair was "terrifying." She recalled an incident when she was in the shower and found handfuls of hair in her hands. "Oh my God, am I going bald?" she remembered thinking.

Despite her fears, Smith chose to keep her hair short and asymmetrical, which she said was a result of her desire to cover up her hair loss. She also revealed that her husband, Will Smith, has shown his support for her new hairstyle.

Smith emphasized the importance of self-care and taking care of one's appearance. She also put her hair loss into perspective, saying that she had to remind herself that others are dealing with much more significant issues.

"When I looked at it from that perspective, it did settle me," Smith said.

Smith also mentioned that she now loves wrapping her hair, adding that it makes her feel "like a queen."

Fiona the hippo was born prematurely at the Cincinnati Zoo on Jan. 24, weighing just 29 pounds, far too light for her species which typically weighs between 55 and 120 pounds at birth. With her weak and unstable veins, Fiona's condition quickly worsened and the zoo called on the nearby Cincinnati Children's hospital for help.

The Vascular Access Team at the hospital used ultrasound equipment to place an IV catheter in Fiona's leg, a delicate and risky procedure. After multiple failed attempts, the team successfully placed a life-saving catheter, giving Fiona the fluids she needed to recover.

Fiona's caregivers lay her on their chests to help her regulate her breathing, and despite a weak start at bottle feeding, she showed progress by early February. She took her first steps on Feb. 5, a milestone that would allow her to be reunited with her mother. Another important step is getting used to the water, as seen in the video above, where Fiona swims and dives happily in a tub.

Fiona's recovery is a testament to the power of love and care, and the zoo is keeping the public updated on her status. Donations are also being accepted to help cover the costs of keeping Fiona happy and healthy. Let us all pray for Fiona's full recovery and a bright future filled with love and adventure.
